investors.name: Aaron Holiday
investors.bio: Aaron is the co-founder and Managing Partner at 645 Ventures, an early-stage venture capital firm that leads seed and Series A rounds. Aaron has 20 years of deep finance and technology expertise, having developed advanced equities Program Trading and foreign exchange derivatives software. As the first Managing Entrepreneurial Officer at Cornell Tech, Aaron worked in tandem with Greg Pass (former CTO of Twitter) to create and pioneer the campus Studio culture and pedagogy, in addition to guiding complex technology startups toward commercial success. Since founding 645 Ventures in 2014, Aaron has worked closely with portfolio company founders to strengthen and grow businesses and achieve scale in pursuit of successful M&A and IPO. 645 Ventures has invested in breakout successes, including Goldbelly, Iterable, FiscalNote, Squire, Resident/Nectar Sleep, FLY Labs (acquired by Google), Source3 (acquired by Facebook), Abacus (acquired by Certify), and several category-defining companies.

investors.name: Abbie Strabala
investors.bio: Abbie is currently an associate at True Wealth, investing in early-stage women-led companies. She brings deep industry knowledge about impact investing, women’s health, and LGBTQ+ rights from prior roles in venture capital and philanthropy. Prior to joining True Wealth, she was a founding team member of the largest US-based impact fund investing in women’s health at RH Capital working in both operations and investment roles. As a representative of the next generation of female investors, Abbie takes pride in being actively involved in the community and creating opportunities to support others breaking into the space. She is based in San Francisco, while the GPs of the firm are based in Austin, TX.

investors.name: Adam Gries
investors.bio: I'm a tech entrepreneur and angel investor on a mission to end aging. In college I focused on neuroscience and did some MRI-based research at Mass General Hospital. I've also been interested in aging and longevity since first hearing the concept of Longevity Escape Velocity in 2007. Since graduating I built and sold 4 companies, reaching over 80 million users. I'm a self-taught software engineer and highly operational CEO, largely with a product inclination, at the 4 companies. I love the intersection of behavior and tech. In the past 18 months, anguished by the unnecessary deaths and institutional incompetence in COVID, I've concluded that "nobody is coming to the rescue" and that I must take more direct action in the aging space. While great people already work to end aging, we need at least 3 orders of magnitude more resources to see major results in 20-40 years. While aging is my core focus I also have invested opportunistically.

investors.name: Adam Nash
investors.bio: Adam is a proven advocate for development of products that go beyond utility to delight customers. At Dropbox, he led the teams responsible for growth, product strategy, product management & product analytics for a platform with over 600 million registered users with responsibility for all of Dropbox self-service revenue (~90% of all company revenue in 2019).Before Dropbox, Adam served as the President & CEO of Wealthfront, where for four years he championed the creation of a new category of automated investment services.  While Adam was at Wealthfront, the company grew its client base by over 60x, and grew assets under management 45x from less than $100m to over $4 billion.Adam holds an MBA from Harvard Business School as well as BS and MS degrees in Computer Science with a focus on Human Computer Interaction from Stanford University.

investors.name: Adam  Besvinick
investors.bio: Adam Besvinick is the founder of Looking Glass Capital. He has led investments in companies ranging from pre-product to Series C throughout his career and has worked closely with founders at each of those stages and beyond.Prior to forming Looking Glass in 2019, Adam invested in Series A and later companies at Anchorage Capital Group and in seed stage companies at Deep Fork Capital. He has made seed investments in companies including Transfix, BigID, One Concern, Ease, Winnie, StatMuse, Transform, Seasons, Primer, Evergreen, and Rebel (acquired by Salesforce). He also has made early stage investments in NomNom, Plant Prefab, Inkbox, and Carrot.

investors.name: Adrian Alfieri
investors.bio: Adrian is the CEO of Verbatim, a new kind of content studio based in Brooklyn. He also runs The Proof, an interview series focused on high performance and modern work. He's an active early-stage angel investor (Levels, Skio, Hone, Mood, LMNT) and a Venture Partner at Melitas Ventures (Magic Spoon, Olipop, Mud/Wtr, Verb).

investors.name: Aileen Lee
investors.bio: Aileen is the founder of Cowboy Ventures. She loves partnering at the earliest stage with startup teams to build products customers love, and to help them scale to build aspirational companies. She works with both enterprise and consumer-oriented tech startups, starting at seed stage and staying involved for many years beyond.\n\nPrior to Cowboy, she joined the venture firm Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers in 1999. At KPCB she worked hands-on with a range of consumer, enterprise and greentech companies including Bloom Energy (BE), Rent the Runway, Shopkick (acquired by SKPlanet), Tellme (acquired by MSFT), and Trendyol (acquired by Alibaba). During that time she was also founding CEO of KPCB-backed RMG Networks, a leading digital out-of-home media company.

investors.name: Alejandra Martinez
investors.bio: Alejandra is an investor at Room40 Ventures, an early stage venture firm based in NYC. Prior to joining Room40 Ventures, Alejandra was a campus venture fellow at NFX and a customer strategy consultant at Monitor Deloitte. She graduated with an MBA from Harvard Business School and with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Architecture from Cornell University.

investors.name: Alex Bass
investors.bio: Alex started angel investing after running a successful operations business focused on software implementation, integration, and automation for 11 years. He has built and launched a mobile app that garnered 30k+ downloads and 550+ 5-star reviews, and has a deep background in product and UI/UX. With a personal portfolio including Motion, Outfunnel, and Mercury Bank, he's looking to get involved with seed-stage companies to help support through the search for product-market-fit in the SaaS/Fintech space.Alex is an LP in Stonks Demo Day Fund + OrangeDAO

investors.name: Alex Hartz
investors.bio: SciFi is Max and Nellie Levchin’s venture fund that partners with exceptional founders solving hard problems that require intense curiosity, intellectual depth, and often, science.  We’re an early stage generalist firm with emphasis on fintech, marketplaces, and science.

investors.name: Alex Tomsovic
investors.bio: Alex is a general partner at Cacti Ventures, a New York based micro-venture firm, that focuses on making seed and pre-seed investments throughout the SaaS, fintech, AI, crypto, and gaming sectors. Prior to Cacti in 2024, Alex was the co-founder and CEO of Galactica Limited, one of the world's first true social online betting platforms. Galactica was acquired by MyPrize Casino in 2024.

investors.name: Alex Zhuravlev
investors.bio: General Partner at Mento VC. Former Portfolio Director of AltaIR Capita (backing Miro, Deel, OpenWeb, and others with $600M AUM and 300+ companies). More than 200 deals made for these 6 years. Went through an entire VC fund cycle from scratch to exit.14 years of experience in IT and tech and over 6 years in the VC industry. Personally invested in such great companies as Miro, Deel, Sunbit, OpenWeb, EquityBee, Lili, June Homes, Jeeves.

investors.name: Alex  Gostomelsky
investors.bio: Alex has launched startups in various sectors and has served as an interim COO for several clients. He has a background in finance and venture capital, and deep industry expertise in asset management, SaaS, and global tech. Alex has helped multiple asset managers with $1B+ AUM scale their operational and capital infrastructure. He has led corporate development consulting engagements for enterprise clients like ServiceNow, Upwork and Mastercard. Alex began his career in banking at Citi and financial services consulting. Alex holds an MBA from the UCLA Anderson School of Management and a BBA from Goerge Washington University.

investors.name: Ali Moiz
investors.bio: Ali is a serial founder (Streamlabs, Peanutlabs), currently opening up access to startup funding with Stonks.com. Active angel in over 70 companies, and an LP in funds. Can help with growth, BD, partnerships and strategy.

investors.name: Allen  Gannett
investors.bio: Founded TrackMaven, which in October 2018 merged with Skyword to form the #1 content marketing platform. Previously, co-founded Acceleprise, a leading SaaS startup accelerator. Author of The Creative Curve, a book about developing the right idea at the right time. The Creative Curve is available in nine languages and has been featured on CNBC, Inc, Business Insider, and more.

investors.name: Ally Warson
investors.bio: Ally is a Principal at UP.Partners. Ally has experience as both an operator and investor. Prior to UP.Partners, Ally worked at Sherpa Capital where she helped transition the firm’s brand; serving as a founding member of ACME Capital. Before venture, Ally held a variety of roles at Google. She led a corporate strategy team for the Ads business; informing product roadmap trajectories and leading international competitive sales trainings for agency sales teams. Ally also worked with Google.Org to facilitate grant awards to sub-saharan African entrepreneurs across 4 African countries, and worked with YouTube to lead video strategy for fast growing consumer brands.

investors.name: Amitt Mahajan
investors.bio: Amitt Mahajan is a serial technology entrepreneur and investor in 50+ startups. Prior to Presence Capital, he was the founder and CTO of MyMiniLife (acquired by Zynga) and the founder and CEO of Toro (acquired by Google). While at Zynga, he co-created the game FarmVille and served as the CTO of Zynga Japan. Before his entrepreneurial work, Mahajan was an engineer at Epic Games on the Unreal Engine and Gears of War.

investors.name: Anamitra Banerji
investors.bio: Anamitra Banerji is Co-Founder and Managing Director at Afore Capital. He served as Board Observer at Localytics and Cushion AI. He previously served as Partner at Foundation Capital, which he joined with eight years of product management leadership experience in the consumer internet space at Twitter, Yahoo! and Overture. He also co-founded an internet-healthcare company PlanetHealthOnline. Anamitra joined Twitter in March 2009 as its 30th employee and first product manager. While there, he built out Twitter's advertising team, incubating from scratch all three products promoted tweets, promoted trends and promoted accounts, he led the team in getting those products up and running.

investors.name: Anand Iyer
investors.bio: Anand is a Visiting Partner at Pear, a seed fund based in the San Francisco Bay Area where he focuses on investing in the crypto / blockchain / web3 space. Prior to joining Pear, Anand was CEO of Trusted, a child care marketplace which was acquired by Care.com in 2018. More about Anand here:https://anandiyer.com

investors.name: Andreas  Klinger
investors.bio: Hello, my name is Andreas Klinger. I am leading the eng team @ On Deck (beondeck.com). Previously I led things related to eng, product & remote @ producthunt.com, angel.co and coinlist.co. If you want to reach me please use twitter @andreasklinger

investors.name: Andrew Gluck
investors.bio: Andrew Gluck is the Founder & Solo GP of irrvrnt. After a decade+ in digital marketing, including founding and exiting Agency Within (now WITHIN), he transitioned into early-stage venture. Irrvrnt is an early-stage fund focused on DTC, AdTech, and NextGen Commerce. We invest $150k - $350k into founders with strong founder-market fit building in large and growing markets. We are happy to invest early: we were the first check a few times, committed before a lead multiple times, and ~50% of our checks are in a company's first non-founder / F+F round. Select portfolio companies include Lunchbox, Caraway, co-op, SoleSavy, and more. Around 50% of our investments include under-represented founders.

investors.name: Andrew McLoughlin
investors.bio: Andy is a partner at Uncork Capital, a seed fund based in the San Francisco Bay Area, where he focuses on investing in seed-stage B2B software companies. Prior to joining Uncork in 2015, Andy was a co-founder of Huddle, a London-based enterprise collaboration platform that was acquired in 2017. Andy was also an active angel investor with a personal portfolio of 40+ startups including Intercom; Pipedrive; Intercom; Tray.io; Bugsnag; Calm; and Postmates. Born and raised in the UK, Andy was awarded an OBE in the 2015 Queen’s birthday honors list for services to the UK technology industry. He is a co-founder and US Trustee of the Founders Pledge and founding board member of GBx, a network for British technology entrepreneurs in the Bay Area.

investors.name: Andrew Parker
investors.bio: Spero Ventures invests in the things that make life worth living. Andrew Parker is a General Partner at Spero Ventures with 15 years of VC experience, previous a GP at Spark Capital for 9 years, and a junior member of the investment team at USV starting back in 2006.

investors.name: Andrew Tan
investors.bio: Andrew Tan was the Founder & CEO of Nova, the leading professional community platform for Gen Z. Nova raised $3.7M in funding and grew to over 250K users before exiting to Handshake. Andrew most recently led generative AI products at Handshake, and is now starting his own AI focused VC fund. He writes an AI newsletter (650,000 subscribers) and Founders newsletter (250,000 subscribers). Prior to Nova, Andrew did a mix of AI research, product management, engineering, data science, and investing at companies like Google AI, Citadel, AQR, Sequoia, Ironfire Ventures, and Branch. Andrew is a prolific angel investor and was early in companies like Anthropic, OpenAI, Pika, Mercury, Replit, Alchemy, Uniswap, Runway ML, Varda Space, Pinecone, Coframe, MultiOn, Chroma, Limitless AI, Gumloop, Haize Labs, Mercor, Goodfire AI, Decagon, and more! Andrew did his undergrad at UC Berkeley in Computer Science & Statistics, and grad school at Stanford in AI.

investors.name: Andrew Trader ("AT")
investors.bio: AT is the co-founder of four companies including Zynga ($10B market cap), Madison Reed (raised $200m), Coremetrics (acq: IBM for $377m) and Tribe (acq: Cisco).  AT helped Zynga become one of the fastest growing companies in history: $1B in revenue profitably in 5 years.Prior to Bullpen, AT was an EIR and venture partner at Maveron.  Most recently, he was the founding partner of Early Impact Ventures, a seed-stage venture fund.  He earned his MBA and BSE from The Wharton School at the University of Pennsylvania where he graduated nadda cum laude.  He's climbed peaks on four continents, and loves time with family and friends.

investors.name: Ann Bordetsky
investors.bio: Serial startup operator (two unicorns, two startups exits), active angel investor and now Partner at NEA (global early stage VC with >600 tech exits). Previously Chief Operating Officer of Rival, Business Development exec at Uber, Twitter and in-the-trenches builder of two pioneering climate and mobility startups. Often helping founders with building scaling organizations, expansion and partnerships strategy, hiring 10x functional leaders and coaching on navigating team inflection points and management challenges. Angel investor in future of work, consumer, climate including Fast, Shef, Warmly, Ethena, PandoHR, Pano AI, LiveFlow, Vibe, Carbon Chain, Elpha, BeyondHQ, etc. Big believer in supporting underrepresented founders (60% of my portfolio is female founder led companies).

investors.name: Ann Miura-Ko
investors.bio: Ann Miura-Ko is the co-founding partner at seed-stage VC firm, Floodgate. She has been on the Forbes Midas List of top venture investors multiple times and on the New York Times global top 20 venture capitalists list.Ann believes in co-conspiring with founders partnering with a select group of only 3-5 founders a year. With over a decade of experience exclusively working with pre-product market fit startups, Ann has seen many of the founders she has worked with pivot into success and has a set of mental models associated with navigating the early stage maze.She is a co-founding member of AllRaise, a nonprofit on a mission to accelerate the success of female founders and funders. Ann is on the Board of Trustees at Yale University where she was an undergrad. Ann has a PhD in Math Modeling of Information Security from Stanford.

investors.name: Anne Dwane
investors.bio: Anne's been a tech company founder and venture-backed CEO who has lived every stage from 0>1 to IPO.  She's co-founder and partner at Village Global, an early stage VC fund backed by entrepreneurs including Jeff Bezos, Sara Blakely, Bill Gates, Reid Hoffman, Magic Johnson and Anne Wojcicki.  Village Global invests in startups and in emerging VC managers across sectors and around the world.Previously, Anne was Chief Business Officer at Chegg, helping take the company public.  Chegg acquired her previous company Zinch, where she was CEO.  Prior, Anne co-founded Military Advantage (www.Military.com), acquired by Monster.com.

investors.name: Anthony Zepponi
investors.bio: Anthony is an investor at Ethos VC and focuses on investing across early to late-stage businesses. He previously worked at ICONIQ Capital – a premier growth-stage tech VC with investments including Datadog, Zoom, Robinhood, Uber, Airbnb, Snowflake, Crowdstrike and Procore amongst others.

investors.name: Ariana Thacker
investors.bio: Ariana Thacker is the Founding Partner of Conscience VC, an early-stage fund pioneering the intersection of consumer and science. Ariana is a technical investor with a portfolio of 30+ companies alongside leading investors. She graduated with honors from UCLA in chemical engineering, with technical expertise spanning Fortune 500 companies to early-stage start-ups. She is a community leader for diversity, with tenure as President of Society of Women Engineers, Founder of congressionally-recognized philanthropic organization, and 50% of the companies in her broader portfolio led by diverse and female founders. Conscience currently has a portfolio ~80% underrepresented founders. Conscience is an early-stage fund pioneering the intersection of consumer and science. We are actively investing in companies that meet the following criteria: technically defensible, science-led business, solving a real problem for consumers, at the pre-seed & seed stages.

investors.name: Ashley Gautreaux
investors.bio: Ashley is Director at CreativeCo, a growth equity studio. She is responsible for sourcing investments, leading IR, and fund operations. CreativeCo's mission is to provide two of the things that early-stage companies need most for growth - capital investment and product/engineering resources. Prior to CreativeCo, Ashley worked at Tesla when it was a startup for 7+ years. She built out many organizations, acquired and integrated companies, and launched new markets/countries. With this operational experience, she mentors entrepreneurs and also angel invests when the match makes sense.

investors.name: Astasia Myers
investors.bio: Astasia Myers is a General Partner at Felicis. She focuses on early-stage investing including pre-seed, seed, and Series A across AI, data, open source, developer tools, infrastructure, and security. Before joining Felicis, she was an enterprise partner at Quiet Capital and an investor at Redpoint Ventures. She has invested in LaunchDarkly,Solo.io, Hex, Semgrep, Airbyte, and Supabase, among others.

investors.name: Auren Hoffman
investors.bio: Auren is CEO of SafeGraph: the place for data about physical places.Auren is the former cofounder and CEO of LiveRamp -- the largest middleware company that connects marketing applications. LiveRamp was acquired by Acxiom in 2014 for $310 million. LiveRamp was formerly named Rapleaf. LiveRamp now is public company (NYSE:RAMP).He is the Chairman and co-founder (with Peter Thiel) of the Dialog Retreat. He is also Board Member of Datavant. He serves as General Partner in Flex Capital.\n\nAuren is an angel investor in over 120 technology companies. He holds a B.S.E. in Industrial Engineering and Operations Research from the UC Berkeley.

investors.name: Barak  Kaufman
investors.bio: Barak Kaufman was the CEO & Co-Founder of Intello, a SaaS management provider acquired by SailPoint in Feb 2021. He's a product leadership at SailPoint overseeing SaaS intiatives.Prior to that he was an investor at Insight Partners, a global software venture capital fund based in NYC.Barak is also an angel investor both directly in early stage SaaS startups and VC funds.

investors.name: Becca Shmukler
investors.bio: Becca is a Principal at the Laerdal Million Lives Fund, a $100M venture fund investing in commercial-stage digital health companies helping to save lives around the world. She has spent the last decade on the business side of the healthcare industry at companies like the Advisory Board Company (acquired by Optum), Castlight Health, and Rock Health. After spending the last 10 years in DC and San Francisco, she now resides in Atlanta, GA with her husband, 6 month old daughter, and dog.

investors.name: Becky Yang
investors.bio: Becky Yang is a partner at The Fund, an early-stage seed fund comprised of seasoned founders and operators investing pre-seed and seed across specific geographies. Becky's 15+ year background spans large-scale and ground-up operator programs in investment banking and in consultative sales and trading capacities, followed by scaling startups with a focus on growth, community and ecosystem development. She is a rare utility player with a knack for solving people and product problems, managing complex projects. She is also an advisor and investor in early-stage companies and is highly passionate about the early-stage entrepreneurial community. Becky cares most about helping founders, building systems to support them, and all the while sourcing and investing in the next generation of founders that are changing the world.

investors.name: Ben Lang
investors.bio: Ben was an early team member at Notion and is now Head of Community. Prior to joining Notion in 2019, Ben was working with companies like On Deck, InVision, and Fleetsmith. Ben actively makes angel investments and advises a few select startups, he's invested in 20+ companies including Commsor, Deel, and Balance. He's most excited about working together with community-led and product-led growth companies.

investors.name: Ben Ling
investors.bio: Ben is the Founder and General Partner of Bling Capital. He has backed 10 "unicorn" billion dollar companies, with the best yet to come.Previously, Ben was a General Partner at Khosla Ventures, where he focused on consumer, Internet, mobile, marketplace, SaaS and consumer health businesses. There, he led investments in Wattpad, Tapingo, Gitlab, True Accord, Webflow, among many others.Previously, Ben served in senior operating roles at Google, YouTube and Facebook. He also is an active angel investor with early stakes in Airtable, Lyft, Square, Palantir, Quora, Gusto, Udemy and others.

investors.name: Ben Mathews
investors.bio: Ben is a General Partner at Night Ventures. Night Ventures is a specialist seed VC that helps founders navigate the creator economy. Our LPs are the top creators in the world across YouTube, TikTok, Twitch and elsewhere. Together, we specialize in influence - understanding what's popular, what's trending and how to acquire more customers/fans of your product. We invest in the best teams in consumer, fintech, SaaS, crypto and health - any company where customer acquisition is the gating factor.

investors.name: Ben Savage
investors.bio: Ben manages Clocktower Technology Ventures and is responsible for all of Clocktower Group’s private market activities. Ben was previously Director, Investment Associate Program for Bridgewater Associates, where he worked with the firm’s CIOs on strategic priorities, talent development and research. Ben began his career as a VC and private equity investor with Wasserstein Perella. Ben also co-founded Artivest fka Resonance Funds, an online issuer of actively-managed exchange traded vehicles, as well as Waterfall Mobile. Ben holds an MBA from the Stanford Graduate School of Business and a BA in philosophy from Yale University. Ben lives in Bel Air with his wife and two young children.

investors.name: Ben Zises
investors.bio: Hi, I’m Ben Zises - angel investor, advisor, and fund manager. Most notably, I was the first investor & founding advisor to quip (2014), Caraway (2018) & Arber (2020), before each had its name. As a former founder, I’ve experienced the complete life cycle of building a company which gives me major advantages: (i) founder empathy, resulting in higher quality deal flow (“access”) , (ii) a unique understanding of the startup journey, leading to my ability to identify what it takes to achieve outsized results (“selection”). Read Deck > SuperAngelDeck.com Founder References >https://superangel.vc/references

investors.name: Beth Turner
investors.bio: Beth is a General Partner at SV Angel. Prior, Beth invested with a family office focused on seed-stage cos, investing in cos such as Clover Health (NASDAQ: CLOV), Flatiron Health (acq. by Roche), LifeLock (formerly NYSE: LOCK), Blue Apron (NYSE: APRN), LuckySort (acq. by Twitter), and Workrise (fka Rigup). Prior, Beth was managing director of a consulting firm and worked with an international NGO with an operational focus in East Africa and the Middle East as well as in clean tech. Beth was an early employee at Adaptly (acq. by Accenture) and lived in Tel Aviv while working for Netafim (acq. by Mexichem) after graduating from MIT.Philanthropically, Beth is co-founder of USA for UNHCR's (The UN Refugee Agency) Humanitarian Coalition and on the Board of Directors at USA for UNHCR.

investors.name: Bill Clerico
investors.bio: Bill is the founder of Convective Capital, an investment firm backing "Firetech" companies: technology companies working to prevent, suppress and mitigate wildfire-related impact. Previously, Bill was the founder and CEO at WePay, which he started at 23 and led for 12 years through its acquisition by J.P. Morgan Chase. At J.P. Morgan, Bill ran the SMB payments business, and led strategic investments in Toast, Touchbistro and Freshbooks. He has been named one of Bloomberg’s Best Young Tech Entrepreneurs & WePay was consistently named a Best Place to Work.

investors.name: Blaine Vess
investors.bio: Blaine Vess is an Illinois native who started Student Brands in his college dorm room and slowly bootstrapped his way to a $58.5 million acquisition. His next company, Solve, was an airport concierge service in Y Combinator’s S17 batch and was acquired later that year. Blaine started Immeasurable to give back, continue learning, and partner with extraordinary founders and investors. He strives to help founders achieve their missions and make a positive impact on the world. Outside of work, Blaine helps North Korean defectors build new lives alongside Liberty in North Korea. He also helps founders and venture capitalists build meaningful and accountable commitments to philanthropy.

investors.name: Brad Holden
investors.bio: Brad leads investments for Protocol Labs, an open-source, research, development and deployment laboratory. Our projects include, IPFS, Filecoin, libp2p and more. Brad Holden joined Protocol Labs from AWS where he launched the Angel/Seed program. He is an active angel investor and a former partner at TomorrowVentures, the personal investment arm for Eric Schmidt. Tomorrow made 75 direct investments with an average investment of $500K in a Seed/Series A including Prosper, Remitly, Maker Studios, Instructure, Legendary Pictures, ThirdLove, Beautycounter, and Shape Security.

investors.name: Bradley Horowitz
investors.bio: Bradley is a Google product executive and advisor, angel investor in Slack, Upstart, Grab, Miro, Coda, Sana and ~100 other great startups. He is an active angel investor and advisor, entrepreneur, teaches at Cornell Tech, and is a board director for both established companies, startups, and non-profits. He holds a B.S. from the University of Michigan and an M.S. from M.I.T.

investors.name: Brendon Kim
investors.bio: As Managing Director and Global Head of Investments, Brendon oversees the fund's global activities, including its operations and the financial investments made in early stage founders building in the technology areas of AI, blockchain, fintech, healthtech, infrastructure, and mediatech. He has over 20 years experience investing in early stage technology companies and previously served as a founding general partner of Altos Ventures. Prior to Altos Ventures, he was a strategy and management consultant in the media, consumer and technology industries.

investors.name: Brian Dixon
investors.bio: Brian Dixon is one of the first and youngest African-American Partners at a Silicon Valley venture capital firm. He is committed to making sure entrepreneurs of all backgrounds have access to advice and capital in order to make their business succeed. For the past ten years, he has worked his way up from intern to Partner at Kapor Capital. Brian is a Kauffman Fellow, Management Leadership for Tomorrow (MLT) Fellow, and two-time tech startup founder. Brian has an MBA from F.W. Olin Graduate School of Business at Babson College and a Bachelor of Science in Computer and Information Science from Northeastern University.

investors.name: Brian Ma
investors.bio: I'm a serial entrepreneur, investor, passionate problem solver, calculated risk taker, and lifelong dream follower. Founder at Iterative Capital (http://iterative.vc/) and Founder at DivvyHomes.com (backed by a16z, GIC, Max Levchin, and Tiger Global).Previously: Founder at Weave (professional networking service, YC S14), Founder at Decide.com (ecommerce price predictions, acquired by Ebay), Zillow, Microsoft, UW Comp Sci. During non-existent spare time: random coding, motorcycle riding, board gaming, poker playing, and starcraft owning.I like to describe my life with this quote: "You can't discover new land unless you're willing to lose sight of the shore"

investors.name: Bruce Hamilton
investors.bio: Bruce is the Founding Partner at Everybody Ventures, an early stage venture capital fund investing at the intersection of pop culture, consumer, and technology. He was previously at Mech Ventures where he invested in companies like Telly, World Champion Fantasy, and Rotender. As an entrepreneur, Bruce founded two startups with one exit. Prior to that, he was in the music industry working with artists like Travis Scott, Fifth Harmony, and others.

investors.name: Bruno Werneck de Almeida
investors.bio: Bruno leads business development for new products at Plaid and is focused on product partnerships, investments, and M&A.Prior to joining Plaid in 2019 as the first Business & Corporate Development hire, Bruno was an investor at Spectrum Equity and previous to that an investment banker at J.P. Morgan.

investors.name: Bucky Moore
investors.bio: Bucky is a partner at Kleiner Perkins where he focuses on software and infrastructure investments. He is a board member and early investor in companies like Netlify, Materialize, Labelbox, Teleport, Rudderstack, Open Raven, Prisma, Calixa, and Codesandbox. Prior to entering the venture capital business in 2014, Bucky was a member of Cisco’s Corporate Development team, where he executed on various M&A, investment, and partnership opportunities on behalf of its Data Center and Cloud Business Units. Bucky holds a B.S. in Business Administration and Finance from the University of Southern California.

investors.name: Camila Saruhashi
investors.bio: Camila is a Principal at QED Investors, a global venture capital firm specialized in fintech companies ($3B+ AUM, 150+ companies, 20+ unicorns, 13 countries). She is based in San Francisco and focuses on early stage (pre-seed, seed and Series A) investments.Prior to QED, she spent her career in fintech as an operator in fast growing companies such as Nubank and Earnin, working in key leadership roles from head of operations to product.

investors.name: Caroline Weintraub
investors.bio: Caroline is a Senior Associate at True Beauty Ventures and a recent graduate of Columbia Business School. At Columbia Business School, she was the co-president of the venture capital club and held various internships in consumer venture capital and high growth beauty start-ups. Prior to receiving her MBA, Caroline spent 4 years at Accenture as a management consultant. While at Accenture, Caroline assisted prestige beauty brands in a variety of strategy and operations projects, including new product launch improvements, effective risk management, and sales and operations planning.Caroline graduated magna cum laude from Northwestern University in 2015 with a degree in Journalism and received her MBA from Columbia Business School in 2021.

investors.name: Cat Hernandez
investors.bio: Cat spent a decade operating in early stage startups before joining the Primary Ventures partnership where she played a critical role in shaping the firm's post-investment approach for the better part of five years. Today, she is a General Partner and founding team member at The Venture Collective (TVC), a transformational, early stage venture business that is on a mission to bridge the funding gap for underrepresented founders on their path to building category-defining, purpose driven companies.

investors.name: Chad Byers
investors.bio: Chad is a co-founder and General Partner at Susa Ventures. He focused on investments in fintech, healthcare and logistics. He led or co-led Susa's investments in: Robinhood (fintech, seed); now public $HOOD, Andela (recruiting tech, seed); now Series E @ $1.6B, Mux (SaaS, seed); now Series D @ $1.6B, Stord (supply chain, seed); now Series D @ $1.1B, Newfront Insurance (fintech, seed); now Series C @ $1B+, Viz.ai (healthcare, seed); now Series C @ $600m+, Sundae (property tech, seed); now Series C @ $600m+. In his free time, he loves skiing, any and all team sports, video games, and musicals.

investors.name: Chang Xu
investors.bio: Chang Xu is a Partner at Basis Set Ventures, where she focuses on investing in developer-led products. She previously was a Principal at Upfront Ventures where she focused on investing in AI and the future of work. Prior to investing, she was a founder and an operator. She was the first Product Manager at the Minerva Project. She co-founded and was the COO of Onion Math, an ed-tech startup in China that has raised $90M to-date. She started her career at BCG where she advised clients across technology, retail, healthcare and private equity. She holds an MBA and AB in Applied Math and Computer Science, both from Harvard.

investors.name: Charles Hudson
investors.bio: Charles Hudson is the Managing Partner and Founder of Precursor Ventures, an early­ stage venture capital firm focused on investing in the first institutional round of investment for the most promising software and hardware companies. Prior to founding Precursor Ventures, Charles was a Partner at Uncork Capital (formerly known as SoftTech VC). He has invested in a number of noteworthy companies, including Shippo, TopHat, Vungle, Drone Deploy, The Athletic, Modern Health, Juniper Square, Noyo, Incredible Health and others. \n\n

investors.name: Charlie Pinto
investors.bio:
Charlie is a Principal at Bling Capital and a YCombinator alumnus. Charlie is also a Program Manager at Google and invests through his angel fund, Fundamental Ventures.

Charlie is focused on SaaS, enterprise, and consumer health deals.

At Google, Charlie leads operations for Google Domains and also leads a group inside the CIO organization that procures Enterprise technologies.

Previously, Charlie was the co-founder and CEO of SlidePay. SlidePay was backed by YCombinator, Initialized Capital, and DCVC. SlidePay was acqui-hired by Rocket Lawyer in 2014. At Rocket Lawyer, Charlie was Director of Product Management and Director of Business Development, where he led the company into a partnership with Stripe to launch Stripe Atlas.

investors.name: Chris Harper
investors.bio: Chris is an investor at Torch Capital - an early-stage consumer tech funds based in NYC. While investing across the consumer tech spectrum, Chris leads Torch's fintech practice and has led investments in Embed, Domain, and more. Chris leads investments out of the Torch core fund (pre-seed - Series A) and Torch's later-stage fund (primarily Series B/C). Prior to Torch he worked at Red Sea Ventures and was a VC Fellow at General Catalyst while at Columbia Business School. In a prior life he worked in trading at Goldman Sachs.

investors.name: Chris Howard
investors.bio: Chris is the founding partner at Fuel Capital where he invests in seed-stage companies across B2B, B2C and Developer/Infrastructure. He's invested in companies like Cambly, Clearbit, Code Climate, Convoy, Figma, Flexport, Highspot, Lattice, Nylas, ThredUp, Weave, and more. Prior to founding Fuel, Chris was at Ignition Partners, where he created and ran the seed program and invested in companies like Pagerduty, Heroku, Parse, and WePay.  Previous to that, Chris spent ten years in advertising and marketing for brands like Lexus, Microsoft, New Balance, Gear.com/Overstock, and the American Cancer Society.

investors.name: Chris Wake
investors.bio: Atypical invests in engineers with empathy. We seek out technical experts developing basic building blocks — aka foundational technologies — with the potential to create new markets.

investors.name: Chris  Lyons
investors.bio: Christopher Lyons is a General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz where he oversees the firm’s Cultural Leadership Fund (CLF). CLF launched in 2018 with the mission to connect the world’s greatest cultural leaders to the best new technology companies and engage, empower, and elevate Black builders and creators on their journey towards excellence in the technology industry. \n\nThe $18M CLF Fund I was Silicon Valley’s first venture capital fund consisting of 100% African American Limited Partners. In turn, 100% of management fees and carry associated with the fund are donated to a select group of non-profit organizations that share CLF’s mission.

investors.name: Chris  Saum
investors.bio: Co-founder, MUD Geochemical. Acquired in 2016. 10+ investments while Partner at RealCo Accelerator. 2016 Forbes 30 Under 30. Now backing pre-seed & seed B2B SaaS founders at Active Capital.

investors.name: Cindy Bi
investors.bio:
Enterprise focused early-stage VC with $100k - $250k checks in via CapitalX.vc.

Since 2011, I’ve invested in over 100 startups (and 10 VC Funds) with High Hit Rate in direct seed investments of 11 unicorns.

I know what it takes to build a high-impact company at different stages, as a long-time executive and operator, a former founder, and consultant at Accenture. Founders also love working with me for being an empathetic executive coach, cheerleader for the early team, and ambassador for their brand and community.

investors.name: Clara Brenner
investors.bio: Clara is co-founder and Managing Partner of the Urban Innovation Fund, a venture capital firm that invests in the future of cities. The fund provides seed capital and regulatory support to entrepreneurs solving our toughest urban challenges – helping them grow into tomorrow’s most valued companies.  Previously, she co-founded Tumml, a startup hub for urban tech. The organization has provided 38 startups with seed funding and mentorship, and hosts thought leadership events around urban innovation. In 2014, Forbes listed her as one of its “30 Under 30” for Social Entrepreneurship. Clara’s work energizing urban entrepreneurship has been featured in numerous press outlets, including MSNBC and TechCrunch, among others. She serves on the Board of Tumml, as well as the Local Initiatives Support Corporation (LISC) Bay Area Local Advisory Committee. Clara earned her MBA from MIT Sloan and BA from NYU.

investors.name: Courtney Chow
investors.bio: Courtney is a Vice President at Battery Ventures, a stage-agnostic venture capital firm based in San Francisco Bay Area, where she focuses on early and growth-stage consumer internet, software, and blockchain investments globally. Previously, she worked on the business-operations (growth) team at LinkedIn, where she led product strategy focused on building active communities. Prior to that, she worked on the strategy and operations team at AmazonFresh, where she focused on supply chain, inventory management and operational strategy. Courtney also spent time as a venture design fellow at IDEO, prototyping venture concepts around blockchain applications, and was also a venture analyst at Collaborative Fund, where she prospected early-stage investment opportunities.

investors.name: Dan Bragiel
investors.bio: Dan Bragiel is the managing partner of Bragiel Brothers, a cleverly titled firm name as he works with his older brother Paul. Based in SF, Bragiel Brothers, has been active since 2016 and has made over 60 investments. Prior to the Bragiel Brothers, Dan and Paul started a few companies, biked across the United States and canoed down the entire Mississippi River.

investors.name: Dan Kimerling
investors.bio: Dan Kimerling started Deciens because of the realization that there was (and, other than Deciens, is) no venture capital fund focused on supporting fintech companies at the seed stage. Having helped start three companies and invested in over forty, he thought that this was a major problem for founders trying to re-shape a sector that is over 20% of global GDP.\n\nUntil September 2017, Dan was a senior executive at Silicon Valley Bank responsible for API Banking, Open Platform, and Global Research and Development. He joined Silicon Valley Bank in July of 2015 through the acquisition of Standard Treasury, which he co-founded and served as the CEO. Standard Treasury - a YCombinator company - was the leading provider of API solutions to the financial services community

investors.name: Dan Moskowitz
investors.bio: Dan is a Partner at Third Point Ventures focusing on investments in devops, infrastructure, next-gen gaming, and cybersecurity. He was previously a Manager at Cisco Investments where he worked on M&A and investments in cybersecurity and across the enterprise stack. During his MBA, Dan worked as a product manager at Unity Technologies, marrying his software engineering background and passion for gaming to build and launch monetization products for the Unity publisher dashboard. Dan started his career at Lockheed Martin, where he participated in the Engineering Leadership Development rotational program, progressing through roles in software engineering, program management, business development, and strategy. Dan holds an MBA from Harvard Business School, an MS in Systems Engineering from the University of Pennsylvania, and a BS in Electrical and Computer Engineering from Cornell University.

investors.name: Daniel Gross
investors.bio: Started Cue, acquired by Apple. Startup investor in Uber, GitHub, Figma, Opendoor, Coinbase, SpaceX, etc. Aspiring runner.

investors.name: Daniel Gulati
investors.bio: Daniel was an investor at Comcast Ventures from 2014 to 2020, most recently serving as Managing Director.

investors.name: Danny Brown
investors.bio: Danny Brown is a Partner at MaC Venture Capital. Prior to MaC, he was Chief of Staff at Atom Factory, an LA-based talent management firm and angel fund founded by Troy Carter. There he focused on leveraging their unique position at the intersection of media and technology on behalf of their portfolio. Simultaneously, Danny joined the Cross Culture Ventures team, where he cut his teeth in early stage venture capital while identifying the next generation of culturally impactful technologists. Danny has a wide scope of focus, geeking out on the future of digital infrastructure, emerging tech ecosystems, and creating opportunity and access to venture capital.

investors.name: Darian Shirazi
investors.bio: Darian is a General Partner at Gradient Ventures. Prior to Gradient, Darian founded Radius, a leading B2B Customer Data Platform, serving as the company’s CEO for 7+ years. He grew the company to over one hundred employees, raised more than $100MM in venture capital from top tier firms, and served dozens of Fortune 500 customers. He is an early investor in many companies including Lyft, Udemy, Carbon Health, Palantir, and serves on the Board of Directors at MainStreet, Contractbook, and Chili Piper, among others. He studied briefly at UC Berkeley, after working at Facebook as a Software Engineer reporting to Mark Zuckerberg, but dropped out after two years to work full-time on startups. Darian lives in San Francisco with his wife and two cats and enjoys skiing, kitesurfing, and Civilization VI.

investors.name: Dave Eisenberg
investors.bio: Dave is the founder of Zigg Capital, a proptech venture capital firm with ~$400AUM. Prior to founding Zigg, he was the founder & CEO of Floored, which was later acquired by CBRE. Earlier in his career he was a very early employee at Bonobos and TellApart. Some of Zigg's more well known investments include Matterport, Loft, Snapdocs, Openspace, Juniper Square, Procore, Kasa and Tend.

investors.name: David Breger
investors.bio: David is a Director of Product at Google. Before that, he led Product teams at Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn. He has worked in several areas in his career, including Consumer, Growth, Social, Marketplaces, Safety, and Privacy. David is also a mentor at startup accelerators and an angel investor in great founders and companies.

investors.name: David Cheng
investors.bio: David is a Principal at DCM. DCM is a top-performing, early-stage focused global VC firm with $4B+ AUM and a 24-year track record. DCM has invested in 400+ technology companies across 14 funds with a total enterprise value exceeding $200BN. My focus is on Seed to Series B investments in Consumer, Fintech, and Digital Health.

investors.name: David Evans
investors.bio: David Evans is the Managing Partner of Sentiero Ventures, an early-stage venture fund that invests in artificial intelligence enabled software businesses.  He is a serial entrepreneur & technologist who started coding at 14, launched his first company at 19, and has exited multiple times as a founder and investor, including a national digital signage network that was sold to CBS and an Inc 500 eCommerce company that was sold to a strategic buyer. In addition, David is the facilitator of the CometX Accelerator for student entrepreneurs at the University of Texas at Dallas and works as an advisor to multiple startups and accelerators. David is a graduate of the University of Connecticut, a former Beneficial Hodson Scholar at Johns Hopkins University, holds a Certificate in Corporate Finance from Harvard University.

investors.name: David Greenbaum
investors.bio: David Greenbaum is a Partner at Quiet Capital, a $1B AUM multistage venture fund investing out of a $500M fund. David is based in the San Francisco Bay Area, where he focuses on investing in pre-seed to pre-IPO investments (investing anywhere from $1-100M) across application software, consumer marketplaces and subscription businesses, and ecommerce and logistics. David has led investments for Quiet globally, including in Latin America (Osana Health), India (LocoNav), and Pakistan (Airlift, TAG). Prior to joining Quiet, David led Finance for Shift, an ecommerce for cars platform that went public last fall, was an investor at Vista Equity Partners, and a consultant at McKinsey & Co.

investors.name: David  Mort
investors.bio:
As a General Partner at Propel, David invests in early-stage companies leveraging technology to transform financial services. His professional experience includes working at leading retail and commercial banks, BBVA, and Silicon Valley Bank.

At Propel, David was a founding investor responsible for identifying, evaluating, and executing investments. Representative deal experience includes $200k to $8M initial investments in companies such as Hippo, Guideline, Newfront, Paceline, Steady, TravelBank, TrustLayer, Azos, Grabango, Tierra, and Ease. David has served on the boards of Steady and TrustLayer and an observer or board guest role at Neon, Ease, Paceline, TravelBank, Grabango, Azos, and Charlie.

At BBVA, David focused on venture capital investments into growth stage businesses, corporate development, strategy, and M&A. He was involved in BBVA’s acquisition of Simple and investments in companies such as DocuSign, Coinbase, Earnest, SumUp, and Personal Capital. David continues as a board observer at SumUp.

investors.name: Davis  Treybig
investors.bio: Former PM at Google, currently an early stage investor at Innovation Endeavors. We invest in entrepreneurs applying technical insights to large industries.\n\nI personally focus on software & data infrastructure, applied data science, and cybersecurity. I also really enjoy working with companies rethinking traditionally underserved industries and processes.

investors.name: Deborah Chu
investors.bio: Deborah is a Principal at NextGen Venture Partners, a network-driven and tech-enabled VC firm, where she invests in early-stage companies across enterprise software, digital health, fintech, and the future of commerce. Prior to joining NextGen in 2019, Deborah was a public equities investor at AllianceBernstein, where she maintained discretionary sector coverage of energy services and healthcare companies, and previously served as a generalist assessing opportunities in solar, internet, consumer products, electric vehicles, and airlines.

investors.name: Deena  Shakir
investors.bio: The daughter of Iraqi immigrants, Deena had a very non-linear journey into venture capital, always orienting around tech and entrepreneurship for impact. Prior to joining Lux, she was a Partner at Google Ventures, led partnerships for moonshot products at Google and directed social impact investments at Google.org. She was also a Presidential Management Fellow in the Obama administration, where she worked in Secretary Clinton's office and at USAID on programs supporting global entrepreneurship. The first-generation daughter of Iraqi immigrants, Deena self-funded her way through college at Harvard and Georgetown. Deena is also on the boards of several nonprofits, a Forbes contributor, Kauffman Fellow, and Council on Foreign Relations Term Member, and Aspen Finance Fellow. She was named a top woman in VC by the WSJ and top 30 under 40 in healthcare by Business Insider. She lives with her husband and two young children in the SF Bay Area.

investors.name: Dilek  Dayinlarli
investors.bio: Dilek was actively investing as an angel and being an active chairwoman since 2017. She has been an angel investor in companies like Picus Security, DataRow (acquired by AWS), Genomize, and Genialis.\n\nPreviously she was an investor at 212, an early-stage technology VC in İstanbul. She invested in companies like IyziCo, the largest Fintech company in the region and Insider, global marketing automation software, funded by Sequoia Capital and so on. Prior to 212, Dilek worked at Groupon as Director of Strategy, Management Consultant at Accenture. She started her career in the USA, where she held different project management positions.

investors.name: Dillon Ferdinandi
investors.bio: Dillon joined Slack in 2016 and co-leads Slack Fund, a $100-million early-stage investment fund, and manages a global portfolio of 75+ companies. He invests in founders at the Seed and Series A stages — specifically those with novel solutions to challenges people face in all aspects of their working lives, from collaboration and mental health to wellness, coaching, hardware, and more.

investors.name: Dmitry Firskin
investors.bio: Dmitry joined AltaIR Capitals as a junior analyst in 2012 and became a principal then. Today AltaIR Capital manages 4 funds (of which 2 are active) with more than $600mln in assets under management. There are more than 300 companies in the fund's portfolio. AltaIR Capital is mostly focused on Fintech, Productivity SaaS, Consumer Web, HR Tech, Media, Digital Health & Wellness but experimenting with other verticals as well. Prior to AltaIR Capital Dmitry was working for the biggest provider of IT solutions and services in CIS and had entrepreneurial experience as well.

investors.name: Donna Harris
investors.bio: Donna Harris is CEO of Builders + Backers, GP of Builders + Backers Capital, and GP of 1776 Ventures, and a Venture Partner at Praxis. She was formerly Managing Director of the Startup America Partnership during the Obama Administration and she is on the Board of the Global Entrepreneurship Network and the Policy Council of the Economic Innovation Group. Harris is also an active angel investor, cofounder of K Street Capital, and was recognized as one of the top 25 female early-stage investors in the United States in 2021. Named as one of Washington DC’s Power 100 by Washington Business Journal and Washington Life, and as a Tech Titan by Washingtonian Magazine, she has become one of the most influential leaders on the intersection of entrepreneurship, investing and economic thriving. Harris holds a bachelor’s degree from Central Michigan University, an MBA from The University Michigan, and an honorary Doctor of Laws degree from American University.

investors.name: Drew Volpe
investors.bio: Drew Volpe is founding partner of First Star Ventures, a Boston-based, seed/pre-seed fund investing with conviction in visionary, technical founders inventing a better future. Prior to moving into venture capital, Drew was an accomplished entrepreneur and technologist. Most recently, he was the founding VP of Product Development for conversational AI startup Semantic Machines. He cofounded Locately and, as CTO, led the development of its location-based analytics technology from founding through successful acquisition. Prior to Locately, Drew was Director of Product Development at Endeca Technologies, a pioneer in search and unstructured database systems, acquired by Oracle for >$1 billion. Drew is an active speaker and mentor for startups at MassChallenge, Techstars, MIT, Harvard, and other innovation centers. Drew holds an AB in Computer Science from Harvard University.

investors.name: Duygu Clark
investors.bio: Duygu Clark invests in early stage technology startups. Duygu also serves as an Expert Evaluator for the European Commission’s $5 billion fund for startups. She is also the Founder of Turkish Collective, a non-profit that aims to advance Turkish startups. Prior to that, Duygu worked for Turkish Telecom, the largest technology group in Turkey, as a Founding R&D Manager where she founded Turkey’s first startup accelerator and managed $250 million R&D projects. Prior to that, she worked for the National Science Foundation of Turkey where Duygu represented Turkey at European Commission and facilitated $150 million R&D projects between Turkish and European organizations. Duygu is a Computer Engineer with Master Degree in Information Systems. She is currently pursuing her executive MBA degree at MIT. She lives in San Francisco with her husband and 3 year old son.

investors.name: Ed Roman
investors.bio: I'm a professional investor focusing on enterprise SaaS, marketplaces, and software infrastructure. I manage a venture capital firm named Hack VC, focused on investing in early-stage startups. I also lead the Hack VC syndicate on AngelList.Most recently, I led innovation for Pluralsight, which is democratizing professional learning. Pluralsight acquired HackHands, where I was recently CEO. \n\nI'm founder of hack.summit(), the largest programmer conference (and the largest virtual conference) in history with 80k+ attendees.Prior to this, I was founder & CEO of Ghostfire Games.Our game Rage of the Gladiator won critical acclaim as a top-rated Wii title.I created the world's largest Java community (450k members), TheServerSide (acquired by Precise Software), and wrote a best-selling book on Java, Mastering EJB.

investors.name: Ed Sim
investors.bio: Founder of Boldstart Ventures, a day one partner and true believer for developer first and SaaS founders. boldstart is a lead investor and often partners with technical founders at company formation, helping accelerate their path to product market fit. Ed is currently a board member/observer of Snyk, Kustomer, BigID, blockdaemon, Env0, Dooly, and Cape Privacy. Other notable day one investments include Superhuman, Security Scorecard, and Front.

investors.name: Eddie Lee
investors.bio: A Principal at White Star Capital based in New York, Eddie invests in and works alongside entrepreneurs in both New York and Seoul.

investors.name: Ela Madej
investors.bio: Ela is a serial tech entrepreneur and a Y Combinator alum (YC S12). She started her first company, Applicake, at the age of 21 in 2006. Applicake was a Ruby on Rails, and later iOS/Android development shop based in Krakow, Poland. Ela later co-founded Base CRM (acquired by Zendesk) and organized large events for software developers in Europe. She had been very active in the Polish & European tech scenes until moving permanently to the U.S. in 2014 after selling Applicake. While living in NYC, she became a Partner at a Polish VC fund, Innovation Nest. In 2015, together with a fellow YC alum, Seth, she co-founded Fifty Years, moved to San Francisco, and she hasn’t looked back since! When she's not talking to incredible entrepreneurs or helping portfolio companies, you'll find Ela biking, dancing, slack-lining, or skiing (rarely all at once).

investors.name: Elad Gil
investors.bio: Entrepreneur, operating executive, and investor or advisor to private companies such as AirBnB, Airtable, Coinbase, Flexport, Gusto, Instacart, Opendoor, Optimizely, PagerDuty, Pinterest, Square, Stripe, Wish. Co-Founder and Chairman at Color Genomics. Was CEO of Color from 2013 to fall 2016. Previously, was the VP of Corporate Strategy at Twitter, as well as ran various product teams (Geo, Search). Joined Twitter via the acquisition of MixerLabs, a company I was co-founder and CEO of. Spent many years at Google, where I started the mobile team and was involved in all aspects of getting the team up and running. Involved with 3 acquisitions (including the Android team) and was the original product manager for Google Mobile Maps and other key mobile products. Also worked at McKinsey & Co. Received Ph.D. from MIT and have degrees in Mathematics and Biology from UCSD.

investors.name: Elizabeth Yin
investors.bio: Elizabeth Yin is a co-founder and General Partner at Hustle Fund, a pre-seed fund for software entrepreneurs.  Previously, Elizabeth was a partner at 500 Startups where she invested in seed stage companies and ran the Mountain View accelerator.  In a prior life, Elizabeth co-founded and ran an adtech company called LaunchBit (acq 2014).  Elizabeth has a BSEE from Stanford and an MBA from MIT Sloan.

investors.name: Emma Peng
investors.bio: Currently an Investment Manager at Target Global, a European VC with more than EUR 2bn AuM. Prior to that, I worked at Alibaba Investments, SoftBank Vision Fund, and Fidelity Investments.

investors.name: Eric Slesinger
investors.bio: Eric is a General Partner at 201 Ventures, investing to advance freedom and autonomy in Europe. 201 specializes in early stage intelligence, defense, and dual-use tech. He founded and runs the European Defense Investor Network, privately organizing capital allocators across Europe to develop the defense tech ecosystem. Previously, Eric invested at Black Opal Ventures, Mundi Ventures, and In-Q-Tel; co-founded HFDC, an emergency engineering company; and served in various roles in the US Government.

investors.name: Erik de Stefanis
investors.bio: Erik is an investor at Interlace Ventures, a NYC/SF based early-stage VC investing in the future of commerce. Interlace is led by an international team with strong European roots. He also invests personally across stages, with an affinity for growth allocations.

investors.name: Evan Moore
investors.bio: Evan is a GP at Khosla, and previously on the founding teams of Opendoor, DoorDash and Vevo.

investors.name: Fabrice Grinda
investors.bio: Fabrice is an internet entrepreneur, investor, student and lover of life, aspiring Renaissance man, and co-founder of OLX, one of the largest classifieds sites in the world. He is one of the founders and managing partners at FJ Labs.

investors.name: Fady Yacoub
investors.bio: Fady Yacoub is a Co-Founder and Managing Partner at HOF Capital, where he focuses on companies leveraging frontier technologies to reshape massive industries. At HOF, he led investments in Epic Games, Klarna, Flutterwave, Terra, and others across sectors and stages. Prior to HOF Capital, Fady worked at Digital World Capital, a technology-focused hedge fund, helping the firm expand its investment portfolio in Asia by overseeing the firm’s investment in Baidu and Qihoo 360. Earlier in his career, he was an EIR at Switch (NYSE:SWCH), which builds and operates the highest-rated colocation data centers in the world.

investors.name: Finn Meeks
investors.bio: Finn Meeks is a Partner at the South Park Commons Fund. South Park Commons is a learning community that brings together technologists looking for their next venture and passionate about making a positive impact. SPC has had over 300 members thus far who have either started their own companies or gone on to join organizations like Google Brain, Open AI, CZI. In 2018 South Park Commons raised the SPC Seed Fund to support entrepreneurs from both inside and outside of the community in their earliest days. Finn focuses on preseed and seed software companies.

investors.name: Francis Sani
investors.bio: Startup growth architect with experience supporting technology entrepreneurs and innovators.At the largest innovation center in Africa, I supported 120+ startups across the continent to raise millions of $ in funding, create thousands of jobs and build high-growth enterprises. I led Pan-African innovation projects with global organizations like Facebook, Airbus, Google, GIZ and more.Currently focused on building the best early-stage VC firm in the world at Magic.fund.

investors.name: Garry Tan
investors.bio: Garry is a designer, engineer, and founder turned early stage investor, co-founding Initialized Capital in 2013. The firm has invested at the earliest stages of companies like Coinbase, Flexport, Instacart, Rippling, and Cruise. Prior to Initialized, Garry spent nearly 5 years as a partner at Y Combinator, advising and funding more than 1,000 companies and founders. He was co-founder of YC-backed blog platform Posterous (acquired by Twitter in 2012) and previously worked at Palantir as a founding member of the engineering team. He also designed Palantir’s logo. Garry holds a BS in Computer Systems Engineering from Stanford University.

investors.name: Gary Sheynkman
investors.bio: Gary is the co-founder and GP of Leyden Ventures. Gary lives in Dubai and works across early stage venture and public sectors. Prior to launching Leyden Ventures, Gary led the launch and day-to-day management of Techstars Dubai (“TSDXB”). He is the host of 🌮⭐ TacoStars, the largest founder social community in the UAE. Prior to launching TSDXB, Gary was consulting with The Executive Office of His Highness Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, Vice President and Prime Minister of the UAE and Ruler of Dubai (“TEO”) on development of Area 2071, a new business cluster within Emirates Towers focused on creative collisions between startups and large corporates.

investors.name: Gautam Gupta
investors.bio: Prior to TCV (www.tcv.com), I was founder/CEO of NatureBox (www.naturebox.com), a digitally native brand of snacks. The company has attracted millions of customers and has over 40% brand awareness across the country. We achieved a lot but had our fair share of bumps. This experience gave me many hard-earned lessons in management, scaling, raising capital, and dealing with “shit-hit-the-fan” moments. I started my career as an early stage investor at General Catalyst. I had the great fortune to join the firm when I was 18 years old and spent the first 8 years of my career as part of the team that scaled it from a small firm to one with global reach. I helped open the west coast office. As a professional and angel investor, I have funded 30+ companies. This portfolio generates close to $2B in annual net revenue. Examples include BigCommerce, GoodData, Honest Company, Grammarly, Imperfect Produce, Pilot, The Pill Club, Heap Analytics, Split.io, among others.

investors.name: Geri Kirilova
investors.bio: Geri Kirilova is a Partner at Laconia where she leads seed investments in business-to-business software companies. Prior to joining Laconia, Geri was a Business Associate at Techstars, where she facilitated program operations and worked directly with ten portfolio companies on customer acquisition, growth strategy, fundraising, business development, and messaging and storytelling. Geri began her venture capital career in Central and Eastern Europe at Launchub Ventures in Sofia and Credo Ventures in Prague.

investors.name: Grace Isford
investors.bio: Grace is the youngest principal and investment team member at Canvas Ventures, which she first joined part-time in 2016 as a campus scout while still studying at Stanford. Since joining full-time in 2019, she has been promoted 3 times. Grace has sourced 10 deals representing over $100M in deployed capital for Canvas including Robocorp, Skyflow, Vendia and Flowspace and serves as either a board director or observer on seven of those ten companies. Prior to Canvas, Grace worked on the LP side at the Stanford Management Company and in product at edtech startup Handshake. She’s passionate about increasing female representation in venture and tech - she served as President of Stanford Women in Business and as an All Raise Captain. Grace also serves on the board of Stanford Technology Ventures Program, which stems from her participation in the Mayfield Fellowship program.

investors.name: Gyan Kapur
investors.bio: Gyan became co-Managing Partner of Surface Ventures in 2020.  Prior to joining Surface, Gyan ran Bayes Ventures, an early stage fund with a similar focus. Prior to Bayes Ventures, Gyan was a Vice President at Activate Venture Partners (first investor in Medidata) and an active angel investor.

investors.name: Herston Powers
investors.bio: Herston is a Co-founder & Managing Partner at 1982 Ventures. Prior to founding 1982 Ventures, he was a Principal at tryb Group in Singapore and created and executed their early stage investment strategy.

investors.name: Hooman Radfar
investors.bio: Hooman is an entrepreneur and investor. He's co-founder and CEO of Collective, Venture Partner at Expa, founder of 10e9, and co-founder of AddThis (acquired by Oracle).\n\nAs CEO of Collective, he is responsible for the strategy, growth, and operations for the company. Collective's vision is to increase the number of financially successful businesses-of-one by enabling self-employed people to focus on their passion not their paperwork.As a founding partner at Expa, he collaborated with the founders and former leadership from Uber, Foursquare, and Twitter to build and invest in category-defining, new businesses. Hooman works with companies like Convoy, Sweetgreen, Thrive Market, Onfido, Uber, and other start-ups as an investor and advisor via his personal investment platform, 10e9.

investors.name: Hunter Walk
investors.bio: Hunter Walk is co-founder and partner at Homebrew, an early-stage venture fund. Before Homebrew, he led consumer product management at YouTube, starting when it was acquired by Google. He originally joined Google in 2003, managing product and sales efforts for AdSense, Google‘s contextual advertising business. His first job in Silicon Valley was as the founding product and marketing guy at Linden Lab. Before graduate school, he was a management consultant and also spent a year at Late Night with Conan O‘ Brien. His parents are proud of his BA in History from Vassar and MBA from Stanford University.

investors.name: Ilya Eremeev
investors.bio: Video games industry professional with over 15 years of experience (10 in development and 5 in investments) focused on free-to-play games. General Partner in the VC fund, scouting for promising games companies and helping them grow.

investors.name: Ilya Sukhar
investors.bio: Ilya invests in and helps startups as a partner at Matrix. Previously, he was an active angel investor and a part-time partner at Y Combinator.He started Parse, a mobile infrastructure company that was acquired by Facebook.He studied Computer Science and Operations Research at Cornell.

investors.name: Immad Akhund
investors.bio: Immad Akhund is the co-founder and CEO at Mercury. Prior to founding Mercury, Immad was the CEO and co-founder at Heyzap, a mobile developer tools company, which sold for $45m in 2016. He is an active investor in Silicon Valley and has invested in 100+ seed-stage startups including Airtable, Substack, and Rappi.

investors.name: Ishan Sachdev
investors.bio: Ishan is a Partner at Deciens Capital, a seed stage venture fund focused on FinTech.  He was previously an investor at Goldman Sachs, Bain Capital Ventures, and PSG Equity, and co-founded MIT Alumni Angels.  He also worked at iPay, a Bain Capital Ventures portfolio company (acquired by Jack Henry), and at the US Department of the Treasury.  He received an MBA from Harvard Business School and a Master of Engineering and Bachelor of Science from MIT, both in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science.

investors.name: Ivan Alo
investors.bio: Ivan is Co-Founder and Managing Partner of New Age Capital, a thesis-driven seed stage venture capital firm investing in technology and tech-enabled companies founded and led by Black and Latinx entrepreneurs. New Age Capital aims to work with the best Black and Latinx entrepreneurs in the U.S. across all industries and sectors at the seed stage where founders have exhibited strong domain expertise and have discovered actionable unique insights to address whatever problem they are solving. They look to invest in companies with a product already in the market with at least six months of traction and revenue.

investors.name: Ivan Kirigin
investors.bio: Veteran founder and operator with experience at iRobot, Facebook, Dropbox, Lyft.

investors.name: Jacob Peters
investors.bio: Built IRL & internet communities for the past 15 years, 2x founder (Commsor, Launch House).

investors.name: Jai Malik
investors.bio: GP at Countdown Capital, former Investor at Rocana Ventures, former PM at Accrete.AI and Forge AI

investors.name: Jake Jolis
investors.bio: I spend most of my time helping early stage founders reach their next milestone. I focus on pre-seed/seed, and also do series A. I find founder psychology to be the single biggest factor in whether a company achieves greatness or taps out pre-maturely. Previously founder/CEO of Verbling (acquired by Busuu).

investors.name: Jake Kaldenbaugh
investors.bio: Jake is one of the investing leaders at Accenture Ventures' Project Spotlight program. He works with senior executives to create strategic engagement with startups that help Accenture solve global 5000 enterprise problems with unique and compelling offerings. Jake has over 25 years of experience in Silicon Valley working with venture-backed technology startups as a founder, boutique investment banker and strategic corporate development executive. He has worked with several public technology companies including CA Technologies, NEC and Borland Software.

investors.name: Jake Zeller
investors.bio: We believe the world needs more builders. That’s why we’re operators—not venture capitalists.Over the last decade, we’ve scaled teams to 1,000+ and raised over $400M from VCs including Sequoia, Google and Tiger.We’re investors or advisors in AngelList, Bolt, MasterClass, Mercury, Scale, Talkdesk and 25+ others.We help with the hard things: hiring/firing, co-founder disputes, fundraising, board issues and scaling.

investors.name: James Beshara
investors.bio: Founder, investor, author, encourager. I’ve started a few startups, sold one (Tilt, acq by Airbnb), and have invested in a few multi-billion dollar companies in my career.I am focused on improving collective strength, health, and connection through technology — as well as in investing in brands that do the same.

investors.name: James Green
investors.bio: James Green is a principal at CRV, a leading Silicon Valley VC where he invests in seed through B stage B2B software companies covering developer tools, cybersecurity, infrastructure, vertical SaaS, fintech and applied ML applications. Prior to joining CRV, James spent almost five years investing at Insight Partners, while also having short operating stints at Built Technologies and Carwow. At Insight, James deployed almost ~$1B globally in companies such as Pipedrive (Acquired for $1.5B), Sysdig, Corelight, FloQast and many others. James holds a BA from Harvard in Evolutionary Psychology and Cognitive Neuroscience.

investors.name: Jamie Quint
investors.bio: Jamie is a General Partner at Uncommon Capital. He has 15 years of experience as one of the foremost product growth practitioners in Silicon Valley. He is an engineer by training, and started his career as a startup founder, joining one of the first few Y Combinator classes in 2008. Since then, he has consulted on growth at breakout companies such as Twitch, Everlane, Mercury, and Substack. He has worked as a senior executive at Notion and Reddit, leading both growth and revenue. Jamie helps portfolio companies with product focused growth, product strategy, product hiring, data infrastructure, performance marketing, lifecycle marketing, and more.

investors.name: Jason Calacanis
investors.bio: Host of This Week in Startups and the All In podcast. Investor in over 300 startups.

investors.name: Jason Levine
investors.bio: Jason is the founder and Managing Partner at Newflow Partners. Prior to founding Newflow Partners, Jason served as head of business development at L Catterton, the largest consumer-focused private equity firm. At L Catterton, Jason sourced the firm’s investments in Cholula (acquired by McCormick), The Honest Company (IPO, Nasdaq:HNST), Third Love, Everlane, and Candiae pet food. Prior to L Catterton, Jason worked as an investment professional at New Mountain Capital and Summit Partners. Jason currently serves as an advisor to Animal Capital, the first venture fund with access to 100M+ engaged consumers across the world. Jason was born in New York and currently lives in Miami. He hods an B.A. in Financial Economics and Entrepreneurship from Vanderbilt University.

investors.name: Jason Shuman
investors.bio: Jason Shuman is a Partner at Primary, where he leads new investments in consumer healthcare, fintech, proptech and marketplaces. The Boston native and University of Miami alum has jumped between sides of the table over the last eight years but started his career as the Founder of a D2C footwear company. Forbes featured him on the 30 Under 30 in Venture Capital list; Venture Capital Journal named him one of Venture Capital's 40 rising stars.

investors.name: Jason Wong
investors.bio: Jason is the founding partner at Pughaus, a consumer brand incubator focusing on investing and advising fast-growing companies in the CPG space. He has been a founder for over 8 years and operated eCommerce properties for Fortune 500 companies as well as his own portfolio of brands.

investors.name: Jed Lenzner
investors.bio: Jed Lenzner is a Vice President at Tusk Venture Partners where he is involved in all aspects of the firm’s venture capital investment practice. Prior to Tusk Venture Partners, Jed led Strategy and Corporate Development at ASAPP, a software company focused on developing AI-Native products for customer experience teams. During that time, he was involved in the firm’s go-to-market strategy and finance operations and was responsible for strategic partnerships. Before joining ASAPP, Jed spent eight years at Allen & Company, the merchant bank, where he was involved in all phases of M&A and financing transactions for enterprise software and consumer internet businesses. He had the opportunity to work closely with the management teams at companies such as Twilio, Okta, Zuora, New Relic, Anaplan, Domo, Desire2Learn, Bonobos, Bedrock Manufacturing, Centene, among others.

investors.name: Jeff Baehr
investors.bio: Based on his own experience running and investing in hedge funds, Jeff created RueOne in 2016 with the realization that the prevailing commingled fund model for investing in alternatives was failing both investors and managers alike. At the same time Jeff recognized that innovative financial technology, regulation, and investor interest in new fund models had coalesced to provide an opportunity for the next generation of alternative investment firms. RueOne is the new generation. Jeff brings more than 15 years of experience in the hedge fund industry as a fund manager and asset allocator with a strong track record for sourcing new managers and investments. In 2007 he founded Empiric Asset Management, LLC, a family of hedge funds where he raised over $150MM and outperformed equity and energy indices through the Empiric Strategic Income Funds & Empiric Market Neutral Funds. Earlier in his career, Jeff was the Director of Research for ARIS Capital Management, LLC, a fund of hedge funds which employs a global multi-strategy investment approach. While at ARIS, he was responsible for conducting investment and operational due diligence on potential hedge fund investments in addition to serving on the investment committee. Jeff also held positions at The Carlyle Group, Deutsche Bank Advisors and The World Bank and Strategic Financial Solutions. He is an honors graduate of The George Washington University.

investors.name: Jeff Seibert
investors.bio:
Jeff Seibert is an experienced serial-entrepreneur and active angel investor.
His current focus is Digits, which he co-founded in 2018 with the mission of delivering modern, intelligent, real-time finance tools for business owners.

Jeff previously served as Twitter's Head of Consumer Product and led the company's product efforts across Twitter for iOS, Android and the Web, as well as its Developer and Data platforms.

Jeff was the co-founder and CEO of Crashlytics, an award-winning mobile crash-reporting service that's installed on over 5 Billion active smartphones worldwide. Crashlytics was acquired by Twitter in 2013 and then re-acquired by Google in 2017 and has become the de-facto crash reporting solution for both iOS and Android.

investors.name: Jenny Fielding
