investors.bio: Jenny Fielding spent the last 7.5 years as the Managing Director at Techstars NYC where she sourced, coached and invested in hundreds of early stage startups including a few that have achieved unicorn status. In 2018 she founded The Fund, a unique community of founders and operators who support the next generations of local entrepreneurs. The Fund is now one of the most active pre-seed investors with $20M AUM across 180 investments. Previously, Jenny headed up Corporate Venture and Innovation at BBC Worldwide where she made strategic investments and led internal incubation projects. Jenny was an early founder in the mobile space where she built apps in VoIP and mobile marketing. She began her career as a lawyer, spent time in banking at JP Morgan and is a graduate of Columbia University and the Kauffman Fellowship.

investors.name: Jerry Lu
investors.bio: Jerry is a principal at Maveron, an early-stage consumer-only VC firm. Prior to Maveron, Jerry was at Advancit Capital, a media-focused investment fund investing in tech-enabled, consumer, and next-generation media companies. In addition to completing his MBA at Wharton, Jerry spent his time before becoming an investor as an operator, leading operations at Spate (a YC-backed startup using data to predict the next big consumer trends). He built his career as a data scientist at Google, where he helped to launch and grow YouTube’s first paid subscription businesses (YouTube Red, YouTube Music, YouTube TV).

investors.name: Jesse Middleton
investors.bio: Jesse is a General Partner at Flybridge, a seed fund based in NYC and Boston that invests in ambitious founders leveraging the power of community. We believe community-driven companies harness the power of a highly engaged, connected, and passionate ecosystem of members to drive adoption, growth, and success. Jesse focuses on consumer and B2B companies building in the future of work, the creator economy, and membership platforms. Prior to joining Flybridge, Jesse was an early executive and founding team member at WeWork, and co-founded WeWork Labs. Jesse was also an active angel investor before turning to venture full time and now has a portfolio of 30+ companies including Chief, Commsor, Imperfect Foods, JackPocket, LaunchHouse, Ohi, Splice, Squire, and Teal. Jesse is also the co-founder of The Community Fund, an operator-led micro-fund investing in underestimated founders across the globe.

investors.name: Jessica Karr
investors.bio: Jessica Karr is a Founding General Partner of Coyote Ventures, an early stage fund investing in women’s health and wellness. Jessica is passionate about innovation that drives positive change in human health, equality, and our relationship to the earth. Jessica worked for 6+ years designing and launching the Impossible burger as the 12th employee; she helped build a pilot impact-focused VC fund with a conscious celebrity; she has developed product strategies as a consultant and advisor to startups internationally; she is an angel investor, Venture Partner at Republic.co, and an active investor in Portfolia’s FemTech fund. She can often be found swimming in the SF Bay and walking her Pom rescue.

investors.name: Jessica Peltz
investors.bio: Jessica Peltz-Zatulove is a Founding Partner at Hannah Grey, an early stage fund investing in founders redefining everyday experiences. Prior to founding Hannah Grey, Jessica was the Senior Managing Partner at MDC Ventures, the CVC of Stagwell Group. Jessica has led investments in Lively (acquired by Wacoal), Mezzobit (acquired by OpenX), Gradient.io (acquired by Criteo), Netomi, Bennie, Catch & Release, among others. Prior to VC, Jessica specialized in connecting marketers with emerging tech and spent 10+ years as an operator working with Fortune 500 brands where she was instrumental in helping startups secure their first customers through brand partnerships.  Her deep understanding of the intersection between customer needs, branding, & technology has enabled her to guide countless startups on positioning & commercializing their business. Jessica is also the co-founder of Women in VC, the world’s largest community for women VCs which now includes 3,700+ women across 65 countries.

investors.name: Jillian  Cohn
investors.bio: Jillian is an investor at Mouro Capital where she focuses on early stage investments in fintechs across the US and Latin America. Prior to joining Mouro, she worked as a fintech investor at Santander InnoVentures, and as an impact investor at Goldman Sachs and at the International Finance Corporation, the private investment arm of The World Bank. She started her career in investment banking at a boutique M&A advisory firm. She has an MBA from Harvard Business School and a BA and BS from University of Pennsylvania and The Wharton School.

investors.name: Jinal Jhaveri
investors.bio: Founder of three companies: Enable.us - Future of Work, Mismo.team - Future of Work, SchoolMint.com - Edtech. Invest in Seed, Series A, Series B and Pre-IPO. Exits: Facebook, Square, Github, Zuora, Lyft, Pinterest, CreditKarma, Postmates, Palantir, PoshMark. Angel/Secondary: 23andMe, Cohesity, Impossible Foods, Automattic, Invision, Marqeta, Calm, OutReach, Roofstock, LendingHome, Blend, Epic(Education), Udacity, Gitlab, CaptivateIQ, Mudrex, Jutso, Aviron, OctiFi, SwiftSKU, Fathom, Cabal + dozens of other early-stage tech companies. Edtech —- SV Academy, CourseDog, GlimpseK12, KickUp, WonderSchool(Syndicate), Tailor-Ed, BoostMySchool, Tappity, Prendea, GetSetUp(syndicate).

investors.name: Joe Tsai
investors.bio: Joe focuses on early stage investments, particularly in software, fintech and marketplaces. Previously, Joe was a Vice President on the investment team at Stripes, where he invested in companies including On Running (NYSE: ONON), BacklotCars (acquired by KAR), Cypress.io, Emotive, Pleo, and Sift. Prior to Stripes, Joe was a management consultant in McKinsey's business technology practice, where he advised Fortune 500 clients on digital strategy and transformation topics including eCommerce enablement, online customer journeys, and data analytics and IT infrastructure. Earlier, Joe was one of the first research analysts at CB Insights, where he delved into the industry of startups and venture capital while working within what was then a ~10 person startup itself. A graduate of the University of Pennsylvania's Jerome Fisher Program in Management and Technology, Joe holds a BS in Economics from the Wharton School and a BAS in Computer Science from Penn Engineering.

investors.name: John Diaz
investors.bio: John Diaz is the Founder and Managing Partner of Stone Mountain Ventures. His focus is on early stage investments throughout the healthcare, AI, consumer and technology space. Before founding Stone Mountain Ventures, John worked at Bain Capital Private Equity as an Associate, Grant Park Ventures as an Advisor, and Wellington Management as a Business Development Associate. He previously interned with Bloomberg and Goldman Sachs and received his BBA in Finance and Risk Management from St. Mary’s University. John is also on the Alumni Board of Directors for St. Mary's University. Additionally, he has founded 2 companies and operated multiple businesses.

investors.name: John Smothers
investors.bio: John is an investor at Acrew. Prior to joining Acrew, John co-founded an eCommerce focused startup studio where he helped successfully bootstrap multiple brands. In addition to his work in the CPG industry, John co-founded Dimension Ventures, an early-stage angel fund. As an angel, he has invested in companies like Brew.com, Bito, Finix, Pipe, Hologram, Prenda, Rosebud.ai, Sorare, and others. John serves on the comms committee at BLCK VC and co-founded a restaurant development company. He strongly believes hospitality principles can carry over to the tech ecosystem. John attended the University of Delaware where he studied leadership and business in the Biden School of Public Policy and Horn Entrepreneurship program.

investors.name: Johnnie  Yu
investors.bio: Johnnie is a GenZ investor at Listen, an early-stage consumer VC fund behind brands like Dame, Calm, Public Goods, Factor, KiwiCo, Interior Define, and more. While obsessed with all things consumer, he is particularly interested in Web3 and brands that build at the intersection of art/culture and commerce. He is also the founder and a core team member at ConsumerDAO, a community of professional consumer founders, investors, and brand geeks passionate about bridging Consumer + Web3.

investors.name: Jon Broscious
investors.bio: Prior to joining Mucker Capital, Jon spent 3.5 years at Social Starts and Joyance Partners focusing on software investments in alternative education, consumer brands and healthcare, with a particular interest in new models of distribution across patients, insurers, and providers.\n\nBefore his time with Social Starts, Jon was a Director with the Advisory Board Company (acquired by Optum) and Education Advisory Board (acquired by Vista) on its internal Strategy and Operations team focusing on revenue maximization across new sales and renewals. He guided teams on new product launches, staffing optimization, market research, customer acquisition and retention, and worked with the corporate development team on several acquisitions within the healthcare provider and higher education industries. He also spent time on revenue cycle consulting with health systems across the US.

investors.name: Jon Dishotsky
investors.bio: Jon is an early-stage investor and mentor focusing on pre-seed and seed. He was previously the co-founder and CEO of Starcity, a global coliving company that raised over $50M in venture capital and was backed by Bullpen Capital, Deciens, NEA, Social Capital, and Y Combinator. Starcity was acquired by Common in 2021 after narrowly escaping the pandemic. He was in the YC Core batch in the Summer of 2016 and the YC Growth batch in the Winter of 2019.He has two core focus areas right now:He is a Venture Partner (EIR) at Giant Ventures (Giant.vc). This multi-stage fund invests in companies solving the world’s most pressing challenges: Environment, Cities, Health & Wellbeing, and Financial Inclusion. You can learn more about the fund here: (https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-09-24/david-miliband-john-browne-join-purpose-driven-venture-fund).He invests out of personal capital as a generalist at the pre-seed stage. His fund, Daft Capital, focuses on mentorship, storytelling, and training of first-time founders to execute their big vision. \n\nThe combined portfolio of companies includes AvantStay, Blair, Buoyant Aero, Craft Aerospace, Elix, Jupe, Marine Layer, Mercury, Mighty Buildings, Block Renovation, Remote, Ruth Health, Verifiable, and Waterplan.

investors.name: Jon Soberg
investors.bio: Jon Soberg is Managing Partner at MS&AD Ventures, where he and his team invest in early stage investments in companies with great teams who are changing the world. Jon is ranked #13 on Business Insider's Seed 100 list of top seed investors.Jon is especially interested in companies that are helping to secure a better future, including financial inclusion, risk analysis and mitigation, climate change, and security. Jon has been investing heavily in Fintech throughout his career and especially focuses on finance companies and business models that are helping people.Jon has been an early stage venture investor for over a decade and has made over 120 investments across 5 continents and has held more than 40 board positions. Many of Jon's investments are worth billions including Addepar, Biocatch, Braze, Clubhouse, DoubleVerify (DV), Fundbox, Hippo, Next Insurance, Nutanix, REEF Technology (ParkJockey), Rubrik, STEM (STEM), Trulioo, and Yotpo.

investors.name: Jonathan Abrams
investors.bio: Jonathan Abrams is an engineer, entrepreneur, and investor. Jonathan is a co-founder and General Partner of 8-Bit Capital.\n\nJonathan is also a co-founder and Managing Partner of Founders Den, San Francisco’s favorite workspace and community for startups and investors. Previously Jonathan was the founder of Nuzzel and Friendster, and a software engineer at Netscape and Nortel. Jonathan is an investor in over 50 startups, and a board member at Girls in Tech.

investors.name: Jonathan Ehrlich
investors.bio: Jonathan joined Foundation in 2013 after 17 years as an operator. Investments include Clubhouse, Chord Commerce, Flexport, Front, Truepill, Bulletin, Shelf Engine, and Agora Brands.

investors.name: Jonathan Hirsch
investors.bio: Jonathan Hirsch is the founder of Syapse, a market leader in precision medicine solutions. Jonathan founded Syapse in 2008, and helped establish the industry verticals for precision medicine and real world evidence in oncology. Jonathan works closely with healthcare providers, life sciences companies, molecular diagnostics labs, and government agencies to create products that improve patient outcomes through precision medicine. Before founding Syapse, Jonathan worked in neuroscience commercial development at Abbott Laboratories (now AbbVie). Jonathan received an MSci in Neuroscience from Stanford University and an AB in Biology and Political Philosophy from the University of Chicago. He is affiliated with several funds, including KPCB Seed fund

investors.name: Jonathan Lewy
investors.bio: Founder @miorden (exit JustEat) & @Grin scooters. Founder & GP @InvestoVC.com

investors.name: Jonathan Tang
investors.bio: Jonathan is a YC alum as well as an early stage investor with the Pioneer Fund. He is also an active angel investor. He's been an advisor to Y-Combinator’s Startup School where he mentored over 50 + startups from around the world.

investors.name: Jonathan Wasserstrum
investors.bio: SquareFoot CEO and Co-Founder; Angel Investing via PropTech Fund + Angel List Syndicate (1600+).  I like buffalo wings, brass bands, and biking.

investors.name: Josh Berns
investors.bio: Josh is a generalist investor at Blue Collective based in NYC. Previously, he founded and led a venture-backed startup in the food-tech space.

investors.name: Josh Kopelman
investors.bio: In 1992, while he was a student at the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania, Josh co-founded Infonautics Corporation – and took it public on the NASDAQ stock exchange in 1996. Josh founded Half.com in July of 1999, and led it to become one of the largest sellers of used books, movies and music in the world. Half.com was acquired by eBay in July 2000.\n\nJosh co-founded First Round Capital in 2004 to reinvent seed-stage investing. Since that time, the firm has invested in over 300 emerging technology startups – becoming one of the most active venture capital firms in the country. Josh has consistently made the Forbes “Midas List” which ranks the top 100 tech investors, earning the number four spot in 2014. Josh has been named one of the top ten ‘angel investors’ in the United States by Newsweek magazine, one of “Tech’s New Kingmakers” by Business 2.0 magazine and a “Rising VC Star” by Fortune magazine. Josh is also the proud winner of a second place ribbon in the 2011 Nantucket Watermelon Eating competition.

investors.name: Joshua Schachter
investors.bio: I have been angel investing for the past 15 years in 250 companies. Prior to investing, I founded Del.icio.us and invented tagging before being acquired by Yahoo. I also spent a decade as a quant on Wall Street, and previously got a degree in Electrical and Computer Engineering. I am a historic and club racer, and runs an an annual autonomous vehicle event where teams are invited to try to get their autonomous vehicles around a racetrack.

investors.name: JP Bray
investors.bio: I've been investing in startups from around the world for over 5 years.  I'm sector agnostic and prefer early-stage startups (pre-seed to Series A).

investors.name: Jude Gomila
investors.bio: Building/operating: CEO, Golden backed by a16z, Founders Fund, DCVC, Giga Fund. \n\nEarly stage angel investor into 250+ investments including 14 unicorns: Gusto, ClearTax, Boom, Astra, Benchling, Ginkgo Bioworks, Airtable, Carta, Ironclad, Superhuman, Mercury, Linear, Calm, Relativity Space, Astranis.

investors.name: Julie Lein
investors.bio: Julie is a co-founder and Managing Partner of the Urban Innovation Fund, a venture capital firm that invests in the future of cities. The fund provides seed capital and regulatory support to entrepreneurs solving our toughest urban challenges – helping them grow into tomorrow’s most valued companies. Previously, she co-founded Tumml, a startup hub for urban tech. The organization has provided 38 startups with seed funding and mentorship, and hosts thought leadership events around urban innovation. In 2016, Living Cities named her as one of its "25 Disruptive Leaders." Julie's work energizing urban-focused entrepreneurship has been featured in numerous press outlets, including CNN and The San Francisco Chronicle, among others. She serves on the Boards of Tumml and Empower Work. Julie earned her MBA from MIT Sloan and BA from Stanford.

investors.name: Justin Olshavsky
investors.bio: Founder of Voyage Bio (YC S19, acquired). Justin is now an active angel investor and a Senior Venture Partner at Pioneer Fund VC. Voyage Bio developed a stroke therapeutic that uses hypothermia techniques from cardiac surgery to reduce brain damage.  Justin was the CTO and co-founder, and the only engineer at the company from inception to acquisition. He is an award winning product designer (SF Design Week, Fast Company World Changing Ideas) and has a background in mechanical engineering (Clemson) and bioengineering (UC Berkeley / UCSF). Justin has been angel investing for ~1 year (since the Voyage acquisition) and has a personal portfolio of 10+ startups, including Kernal Biologics, Known Medicine, Sixfold Bioscience, and Faction.

investors.name: Kaitlyn Doyle
investors.bio: I’ve worked with companies big and small throughout my career and I’m thrilled to assist in TechNexus’s mission of bridging the gap between corporations and early-stage ventures. My role is to assist in sourcing, due diligence, post-investment collaboration, deal syndication, and venture operations. Prior to TechNexus, I was an early employee at IrishAngels, a Notre Dame-affiliated angel network. I helped grow the network to over 200 individual investors and 30+ investments. I’m a graduate of the University of Notre Dame and the University of Chicago- Booth School of Business, where I specialized in finance and entrepreneurship. Outside of work, I can be found running on the Lake Shore path, reading a new book, or playing with my golden retriever.

investors.name: Kamal Ravikant
investors.bio: Kamal Ravikant has meditated with Tibetan monks in the Dalai Lama's monastery, served in the US Army infantry, walked 550 miles across Spain, and self-published a bestselling self-help book. Kamal has also worked with some of the most influential people in Silicon Valley as an entrepreneur and investor, and has founded several companies. He lives in New York City

investors.name: Katie Stanton
investors.bio: Katie is the Founder and General Partner of Moxxie Ventures.Prior to Moxxie, Katie served in numerous executive operating roles at Twitter, Google, Yahoo, and Color. She has led teams in marketing, comms, recruiting, product and media. In addition to working in Silicon Valley, Katie served in the (Obama) White House and State Department and began her career as a banker at JP Morgan Chase. Katie sits on the Board of Vivendi, a French multinational media company headquartered in Paris, and previously served on the Board of Time Inc.  Katie started her venture career as a Founding Partner of #Angels and has invested in 40 early-stage companies including Airtable, Cameo, Carta, Coinbase, Clubhouse, Literati, Modern Fertility, Shape Security and Threads.

investors.name: Keith Bender
investors.bio: Keith is a Principal at Pear. He joined after graduating from Harvard Business School, where he met the Pear team. As an investor, Keith looks for products that are beloved, indispensable, and built by founders who never want to stop learning. Previously, Keith worked at Bessemer Venture Partners, consulted for consumer and energy companies at BCG, and long ago spent a summer working for his hometown Arizona Diamondbacks. He graduated from Harvard College.

investors.name: Kevin Colleran
investors.bio: Managing Director at Slow Ventures, a US-based venture capital firm with ~$450M USD under management. Slow has Invested in the early stages of over 300 technology companies including Allbirds, Everlane, Angellist, Airtable, Ro (Roman), Pinterest, Pillpack, Robinhood, Postmates, Nextdoor, Wealthfront, Casper, Blue Bottle, Slack, Common, Gusto, StyleSeat, and many more.Former Venture Partner and Advisor at General Catalyst Partners (2011 - 2014)Former Wall Street Journal columnist as part of the 'Accelerators' section giving start-up advice to entrepreneurs.Previously: Joined Facebook in early 2005 as one of the first 10 employees. Spent 6.5 years developing and running key global advertising partnerships with Coca-Cola, Procter & Gamble, Johnson & Johnson, Walmart, and many other global brands. Left Facebook in July 2011, after having become the longest-tenured employee (other than Mark Zuckerberg), to become a venture capital investor.

investors.name: Kevin Liu
investors.bio: Kevin Liu leads the Portfolio Capital & Investments group at Techstars, where he works with companies on deal evaluation, fundraising, and follow-on investments. Prior to joining Techstars, Kevin led Data Science & Analytics at Mattermark (sold to FullContact). Kevin is an early investor in Vise, Culture Biosciences, Retool, Seldon, Doorvest, Wunderite, Hightouch, Roboflow, etc.

investors.name: Kevin Weatherman
investors.bio: Kevin was an investor and early-stage executive who has joined companies at the seed stage to help scale the business to a Series A fundraising and beyond. He helped to scale three startups from less than 10 employees to over 100+ including scaling MoPub from $0 to over $250M+ as the first business hire. He helped lead business through MoPub’s acquisition by Twitter in 2013. Kevin is passionate about creating successful companies with the foundation of talented people, culture, and process to build a strong market-leading product. He is an enthusiast of OKRs, and the lessons from Jim Collin's 'Good to Great' & Ben Horowitz's 'Hard thing about hard things.'

investors.name: Kirsten Green
investors.bio: Kirsten launched San Francisco-based Forerunner Ventures in 2010, where she serves as Founder and Managing Partner.As a founder, Kirsten has led efforts to raise over $1B+ from leading institutional investors and invest in more than 100 companies. She currently serves as a member of the Board of Directors at Glossier, Ritual, Faire, The Yes, Hims & Hers, Curated, and Modern Fertility. She also served on the board of Dollar Shave Club and Bonobos, two Forerunner portfolio companies with notable sale transactions. She is also a member of the Board of Directors at Nordstrom, Inc (NYSE: JWN).Kirsten has been honored in Time’s 100 Most Influential People, named a Top 20 Venture Capitalists by The New York Times in 2018 & 2017, is part of Forbes' 2020, 2019, 2018 & 2017 Midas Lists, in addition to being named in the magazine’s World’s 100 Most Powerful Women.

investors.name: Kiva Dickinson
investors.bio: As Managing Partner Kiva leads all deal sourcing and execution efforts for Selva Ventures, and works closely with portfolio brands. Prior to founding Selva Ventures Kiva was a Partner at CircleUp, where he joined during the launch of the Company’s first discretionary equity fund CircleUp Growth Partners.  While at CircleUp Kiva led Series B investments in Nutpods and Liquid I.V., working closely with both companies following investment. Prior to CircleUp, Kiva was a private equity investor in San Francisco at TPG Capital. There, he focused on a combination of consumer and digital media companies. Kiva was involved in TPG’s Series B investments in Lynda.com (subsequently acquired by LinkedIn) and Ipsy. Prior to TPG, Kiva began his career in Los Angeles at Barclays in consumer-focused investment banking.

investors.name: Koda Wang
investors.bio: Koda M. Wang is the co-founder of Block Renovation. Prior to that, Koda served as the chief customer officer at Rent The Runway and COO at HuffPost.

investors.name: Krista A. Worzalla
investors.bio: Krista is an Associate at Swiftarc Ventures responsible for deal sourcing and due diligence, as well as strategizing with portfolio companies on operational optimization and growth. Before joining Swiftarc full-time, Krista was a Venture Fellow while pursuing her MBA at NYU Stern School of Business. At Stern, Krista focused on the retail sector, building industry expertise and a refined understanding of consumer behavior, winning retail strategies, and emerging trends. She interned and consulted at companies like Frank Body, Watches of Switzerland, and Calvin Klein. Previously, Krista was a consultant for over seven years, beginning her career in valuation and then transitioning into change management and operations improvement. Through these consulting engagements, Krista worked with numerous Fortune 500 clients to identify current operational pain points, reformulate processes and procedures, and implement change through communications and training.

investors.name: Kristin (Stannard) Kent
investors.bio: Kristin Kent is a Principal at Expa based in LA, investing in and supporting talented pre-seed founders. Prior to joining Expa, Kristin led product and design teams at 3D home design company Modsy. She has also held growth, product marketing, and business development roles for early-stage startups Calm, Foursquare, Bloom Energy, and Rocket Fuel. A graduate of Stanford University, she played varsity soccer and graduated with a B.S. in Civil & Environmental Engineering.

investors.name: Kyle Lui
investors.bio: Kyle is a partner at DCM, a top performing early stage venture fund with a global presence. Prior to DCM, Kyle was the co-founder & CEO of ChoicePass (acquired by Salesforce) and Director of Product at Salesforce and a member of the Work.com founding product team. Kyle is also on the board of the UCSF Health Hub. As a former founder, he deeply understands the founder journey and strives to be the first call his founders make.

investors.name: Lacey Johnson
investors.bio: Lacey is a Partner with Alumni Ventures, a $750-million multi-stage venture capital firm, where she focuses on investing in early-stage digital health, enterprise SaaS, and impact companies.  Prior to joining Alumni Ventures in 2017, Lacey worked at CareGroup Investment Office, a $3 billion manager of combined endowment and pension assets, where she led investment opportunities across asset classes and strategies. Previously she was an Associate at J.P. Morgan and an Analyst at Goldman Sachs.

investors.name: Lainy Painter Singh
investors.bio: Lainy is a partner at Craft Ventures. Craft is a Venture Capital firm that has led investments in startups like ClickUp, Sourcegraph, and SpaceX. Lainy invests primarily in SaaS and Marketplaces. She is board member or observer for Trusted Health, Explo, Fellow, and Northspyre. She is based in New York City.Prior to Craft, Lainy worked at Battery Ventures in San Francisco. Previously, Lainy worked at Gainsight, a B2B customer success startup where she helped lead business operations and strategy across the organization, including initiatives to grow services revenue and drive product adoption. Lainy started her career at Goldman Sachs on the technology, media and telecom investment banking team, advising companies including PayPal, LinkedIn, and Zendesk. She graduated summa cum laude from the College of William and Mary.

investors.name: Lan Xuezhao
investors.bio: Lan is the founding partner of Basis Set Ventures (www.basisset.vc), an early stage venture firm focused on Machine Learning and Automation with $300M+ AUM. Lan built the Corporate Development Strategy team at Dropbox, which was one of the most acquisitive private tech companies during her tenure with 30+ acquisitions. Prior to Dropbox, she worked with McKinsey in New York and Shanghai, advising Fortune 500 companies on issues including big data, AI, and growth strategy. Earlier in her career, Lan was an entrepreneur who built brain training games. She studied human brain functions for her Ph.D. and received her MA in Statistics, both from the University of Michigan.

investors.name: Lee Jacobs
investors.bio: Lee Jacobs is founding partner and general partner of Long Journey Ventures. Long Journey Ventures is a venture capital firm backed by the world’s best technology investors. Lee and his partners have invested in iconic companies like Uber, SpaceX, Niantic, Postmates, etc.

investors.name: Leo Polovets
investors.bio: I'm a co-founder and General Partner at Susa Ventures. I invest across sectors, but mostly focus on b2b companies. A few specific sectors I've invested in heavily are enterprise software; developer tools and technical products; and logistics and supply chain. I led Susa's investments in dozens of companies, including Outlier, Pex, Scalyr, and Stedi.Having been a software engineer for 10+ years, I approach challenges with an engineering mindset and support portfolio companies in vetting and hiring technical talent.Prior to Susa, I was the second engineering hire at Linkedin where I helped build the first versions of products like LinkedIn Jobs and LinkedIn Groups. I then worked on payment fraud detection algorithms at Google, and was also an early engineer at Factual, where I built data cleaning, processing, and deduping software.

investors.name: Lex Zhao
investors.bio: At One Way Ventures, Lex identifies investment opportunities, leads diligence, and works with entrepreneurs to help build large, enduring companies. Lex previously led the operations team at Vestwell, a venture-backed fintech startup. Prior to Vestwell, Lex earned his MBA with Honors from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. At Chicago Booth, he was an Associate at Moderne Ventures and took part in the New Venture Challenge startup accelerator. Lex started his career at Bridgewater Associates, the world’s largest hedge fund, and NERA Economic Consulting, a leading economic consultancy. Lex graduated Phi Beta Kappa from Cornell University where he earned his B.A. in Economics with Distinction. Lex has also passed all three levels of the CFA Program. Location: Boston and New York

investors.name: Li Jin
investors.bio: I'm interested in companies that are enabling individuals to make a living from their unique passions and audiences.If you are working on a big idea that re-imagines how consumers live and work, I'd love to hear from you!

investors.name: Luisa Sucre
investors.bio: Luisa is an Investor at Collaborative Fund, an early stage investment firm based in NYC, where she focuses on seed investments. Prior to joining Collaborative, Luisa was an investor at Revolution's Growth Fund based in Washington, DC. Luisa was born and raised in Caracas, Venezuela. She graduated from Stanford's Graduate School of Business with a Certificate of Social Innovation and from the University of Pennsylvania with a B.A. in Politics, Philosophy, and Economics.

investors.name: Mallun Yen
investors.bio: Mallun is the founder of Operator Collective, a fund and the dream community of Operator LPs created to open the venture ecosystem to the people it needs most: tech leaders from diverse backgrounds with deep, present-day experience building the most successful companies in the world. Its LPs include 150+ ultra-talented operators who have decades of experience building, growing, and running the world’s most admired companies - from Salesforce, Stripe, and Zoom to Cloudflare, Confluent and beyond.Mallun previously founded/built up three additional category-creating companies, each with vibrant communities, including venture-backed RPX Corp ($0 to $100M & IPO in 3 years), SaaStr (the world’s largest b2b software community), and ChIPsNetwork.org (4,000 members and 20 worldwide chapters). She is a board director of Pure Storage (NYSE: PSTG) and a former board director of the public media organization, KQED.

investors.name: Manan Mehta
investors.bio: Manan is a founding partner of Unshackled Ventures. Prior to Unshackled Ventures, Manan ran marketing for ed-tech startup Kno that raised over $90M of funding from top VCs including a16z, First Round Capital, and Floodgate. The company was acquired by Intel in 2013. Before Kno, Manan was an investment banker at the Royal Bank of Canada, with his most notable deal being the $1.9B acquisition of Skype led by Silver Lake and Andreessen Horowitz in 2009 — later sold to Microsoft for $8.5B. Manan received his B.S. in Material Science and Engineering and B.A. in Economics from UCLA in 2007. He also studied Entrepreneurship and Marketing at the London School of Economics. Beyond academics at UCLA, Manan was also the captain and lead of a national championship-winning dance team. Manan has been invited by the White House and the U.S. State Department to speak at the Global Entrepreneurship Summit.

investors.name: Mar Hershenson
investors.bio: Mar Hershenson is a co-founder and Managing Partner at Pear VC, a seed-stage investment firm in Palo Alto backing companies like Guardant Health(NASDAQ: GH), Doordash (NYSE:DASH), Gusto, Aurora Solar and Branch. Prior to Pear, Mar co-founded three companies and held executive positions in product and engineering at Magma Design Automation. Mar holds a PhD in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University, where is currently a Lecturer in the Engineering School. Mar also serves on the Board of Trustees of Harvey Mudd College and on the Advisory Council of the Electrical and Computer Engineering Department at Carnegie Mellon University and is a founding member of All Raise and the Equity Summit.

investors.name: Marc McCabe
investors.bio: Nomad Capital is a seed stage fund founded by Marc McCabe and backed by incredible operators and investors across US and Europe. Prior to Nomad, Marc held operational roles at Airbnb and Google and has been an active Angel investor (SV Angel, Sequoia Scouts), investing in the seed rounds of Opensea, Intercom, Deel, Papa, Linear and Modern Health. At Airbnb, Marc led and scaled teams working on Business Development, Airbnb for Business and Samara (Airbnb R&D).

investors.name: Mario Mitchell
investors.bio: Mario Mitchell is a natural business developer, marketer, and chief operator. Having served in the military, Mario learned how to truly become a leader while perfecting his skills at design thinking and relationship management. Mario believes in a collaborative consultative approach and commitment to exceeding expectations. A firm believer that if given the chance people can create greatness. Everyone has a dream and just needs a helping hand. Working with nonprofits in Las Vegas like Nevada Partners Promised Neighborhood, Mario helps create technology programs to enhance the Westside community. Mario serves as the lead Ambassador for Bunker Labs in Las Vegas and is the Nevada State Coordinator for Global Entrepreneurship Network. He is also the Chairman/ Vice President of the Southern Nevada Veteran Chamber of Commerce. Looking to create a sustainable ecosystem for entrepreneurs in Las Vegas.  He’s also a tech advocate, who fully supports Blacks and Veterans in technology.

investors.name: Mark Ghermezian
investors.bio: Co-Founder & Founding CEO (9+ years) of Braze, (Nasdaq: BRZE). Grew company to $100M ARR, IPO Market Cap of $8B+ (Nov ’21). Managing partner of T5 Capital. Deployed ~$5.5M of capital across 56 tech/software startups. Director of Zedge and strategic advisor & board member of several successful startups.

investors.name: Mark Lee
investors.bio: Mark is an investor at Mucker Capital based in Southern California. He was previously a Product Management leader at companies like eBay, PayPal, Visa and a Founder/CEO of Enroll Hero, a Techstars-funded startup in the health insurance space.

investors.name: Mark Tomasovic
investors.bio: Venture capital investor focused on digital technology for energy and industry. Prior experience includes operations management at ExxonMobil and private equity investing at Bernhard Capital Partners. MBA from Harvard Business School and B.S. in Chemical Engineering from the University of Texas at Austin.

investors.name: Matt Brezina
investors.bio: Matt Brezina founded, scaled & sold two startups: Xobni YC S06 (acq Yahoo), Sincerely (acq Liberty Media).  Matt has been angel investing since 2008 and has backed over 80 companies including breakouts: Dropbox, Ring, FunctionOfBeauty, Solugen, Mercury, Snapdocs, Cruise, Rescale, Tonal, Karat. Matt has invested across a diverse range of markets including Marketplaces, HealthTech, B2B SAAS, Fintech, Hardware+service, Climate Tech as well as across the US, Latam, Africa, Middle East & Europe. Matt was one of the earliest scouts, deploying money for CRV & Spark Capital. Matt is hyper-involved in hiring, fundraising, positioning and product from day zero through series A, and then shifts to a founder advisory role. His goal is to be the first person founders call for advice. Matt has helped on over 12 M&A transactions. Matt also started the Penn State Summer Founders Program and is the Founder of KidSafeSF a movement to make streets safe for travel by walking & bicycle.

investors.name: Matt Hayes
investors.bio: Matt is a General Partner at PJC and focuses on the firm’s consumer and enterprise technology investments. Prior to PJC, Matt was a member of the founding team at Teespring.com, an innovative commerce platform with backers such as Y Combinator, Andreessen Horowitz, and Khosla Ventures. At Teespring, Matt’s responsibilities included seller growth, business development, strategic partnerships, and corporate initiatives during a period of rapid growth. Matt received his MBA from Columbia Business School and his undergraduate degree at the University of Rhode Island with a B.S. Accounting, Magna Cum Laude.

investors.name: Matt Heiman
investors.bio: Matt Heiman is a partner and co-founder of Vetamer Capital, an investment firm that makes concentrated long-term investments in both public and private companies globally, with a focus on financial technology and related sectors. Previously he served as a Partner at CRV and an investor at Greylock Partners. Earlier in his career he worked at McKinsey & Co.

investors.name: Megan Ananian
investors.bio: Megan is GP at The Helm, a NYC-based women-led fund investing in female founders. Prior to joining the team, Megan invested in early-stage startups at Seedinvest, worked as a product manager at places like Circle Pay and 2U, and financed over $1Bn in bond transactions at Wells Fargo. She received her MBA from Yale and BS from University of South Carolina.

investors.name: Mendy Yang
investors.bio: Mendy Yang is an Investor at Lerer Hippeau. She joined from Soma Capital, an early-stage venture firm based in San Francisco. Previously, she was an investor at Vista Equity Partners, an enterprise software-focused private equity firm based in Austin and an analyst on the Strategy and M&A team at AIG, a global insurance provider based in NYC. Mendy graduated from Yale University, where she double majored in Economics and Psychology.

investors.name: Michael Cardamone
investors.bio: Michael is the Managing Partner at Forum Ventures (formerly Acceleprise). They are a B2B SaaS focused seed fund and pre-seed accelerator with offices in SF, NYC and Toronto. Prior to starting Forum Ventures, Michael was an early employee at Box and spent time at an Ed tech company called AcademixDirect.

investors.name: Michael Downing
investors.bio: Silicon Valley serial entrepreneur, angel investor and founder of MDSV Capital, a Palo Alto based emerging manager fund of funds and direct investment vehicle.

investors.name: Michael Egziabher
investors.bio: Michael is a Principal at Basecamp, and is focused on investing in visionary entrepreneurs. He is interested in B2B, and consumer focused companies in the U.S. and abroad.Prior to Basecamp, Michael was the GM for Uber/JUMP in Southern California where he developed, and implemented the operations, marketing, and policy strategy for the region, overseeing launch, and growth initiatives, budgeting, P&L performance, and operational optimization. He also has experience working in early, and growth stage fintech, and healthcare services companies, as well as financial advisory, and investing roles.

investors.name: Michael Lee
investors.bio: Michael is an investor at Bull City Venture Partners where he focuses on early and growth stage investments in SaaS, eCommerce, Fintech and Healthcare IT. Prior to BCVP, Michael was an investor at FJ Labs where he focused on e-commerce investments (both consumer brands and commerce infrastructure). Michael began his career at Truebridge Capital Partners where he split his time on the VC fund-of-funds practice as well as the growth investment fund, where he worked on investments in companies like Slack, SeatGeek, and Postmates. Michael did his schooling at UNC, where he returns frequently to lecture on venture capital topics.

investors.name: Michael Ma
investors.bio: Michael Ma is General Partner at Liquid2 Ventures, a seed-stage venture fund. He was previously a product manager at Google, where he led Google My Business mobile. Before that, he co-founded YC-backed TalkBin, which was acquired by Google five months after launching. He has a BA from Yale University and an MBA from Harvard Business School. He was also listed to Forbes 30 under 30 for Venture Capital in 2017.

investors.name: Milun Tesovic
investors.bio: Milun Tesovic is a General Partner at Uber co-founder Garrett Camp’s startup studio and VC, Expa. He is a serial entrepreneur, investor, and computer engineer who is known for founding multiple startups with recent successful acquisitions by publicly traded corporations—most recently Gitalytics (acquired by GitHub/Microsoft) and infrastructure detection and response company, Cmd (acquired by Elastic). Tesovic has also been an early stage investor in several successful companies like Uber, Sleeper, Statespace, Klue, Recon Instruments, and many more. But his entrepreneurial journey began when he was only 16 as co-founder of MetroLyrics, the largest music lyric site with 50 million monthly uniques, which he sold to CBS in 2011—making Tesovic one of the youngest entrepreneurs to sell his company to a Fortune 500.

investors.name: Mitra Lohrasbpour
investors.bio: Mitra is a Partner with the SPC Fund. She joined South Park Commons from Nava Public Benefit Corporation, the software company responsible for the improved healthcare.gov insurance marketplace. At Nava, Mitra spearheaded business development efforts and won contracts also to build new VA benefit appeals and Medicare incentive payments systems. Prior to Nava, she led revenue analytics and international expansion efforts at Dropbox. Mitra began her career at Bain as a management consultant and is on the board of LeanMarket. She graduated from MIT.

investors.name: Mo Islam
investors.bio: Mo is focused on enterprise, fintech and frontier technologies. He sits on the boards of CrowdAI, EdgeQ, Elementary Robotics, and several stealth companies. He has also sourced and/or co-led investments in Mythic, Yellowbrick, Imagen, Upside Foods, Atomwise, and Zymergen.Mo was on the technology team at In-Q-Tel, where he conducted technical diligence on behalf of the CIA. Mo also held engineering roles at Lockheed Martin, the National Science Foundation, and the Pacific Northwest National Laboratory.Mo graduated with a BS in electrical engineering, with interdisciplinary honors in international security studies, and an MBA from Stanford University.​In 2018, Mo was named to Business Insider’s list of Silicon Valley biotech stars. He was also featured in the 2017 Forbes 30 under 30 Venture Capital list.

investors.name: Mohammed Amdani
investors.bio: Mohammed is a General Partner at Adapt Ventures. Previously, he was on the investment team at Plug and Play Ventures in Silicon Valley, focusing on investments across geographies such as Latin America, Europe, South-East Asia, and MENA. He supports portfolio companies in various forms such as business development, hiring, and fundraising. Mohammed holds a BS from New York University in Finance & Economics, where he graduated a year early, and an MS in Finance & Accounting from Imperial College London.

investors.name: Morgan Livermore
investors.bio: Morgan Livermore is a Partner at Quiet Capital and focuses on emerging enterprise applications, DevOps, IT Infrastructure, fintech, and has a passion for autonomous vehicle technologies. Prior to Quiet, Morgan was a Partner at Geodesic Capital and involved with the investments in JFrog, Aurora, Marqeta, UiPath, Imply.io, Workato, HashiCorp, Vercel, Confluent, Clearcover, and MX. Prior to Geodesic, Morgan was an investor at Accel, where he invested in GoFundMe, PagerDuty, Algolia, and Browserstack. Prior to Accel, Morgan was an Associate at Vista Point Advisors. He was previously the owner of Evolving Vox. Morgan lives in San Francisco with his wife, Caroline. He’s an avid Bay Area sports fan and plays goalie for the Olympic Club Men’s Soccer Team.

investors.name: Nakul Mandan
investors.bio: I am the Founder at Audacious Ventures, where we lead seed stage investments. Prior to Audacious, I was a partner at Lightspeed. Over the last decade, I've backed several category defining companies and marketplaces such as Marketo, Gainsight, People.ai, 6Sense, BuildingConnected, WorkOS, Multiverse amongst others. I look for ambitious and hungry product founders targeting large markets. I believe hunger and ambition are more important ingredients of success than experience.

investors.name: Nate Bosshard
investors.bio: Entrepreneur, investor and brand builder of iconic, category-defining, multi-billion dollar consumer businesses. My superpower is brand creation, positioning, and go-to-market strategy. I've lead brand platform development and positioning, marketing strategy and planning, and consumer acquisition and engagement both on and offline.I've been a marketing leader at every stage of company growth. I've lead and re-positioned heritage brands through changing market dynamics, been on the IPO rocketship, experienced being inside of a company acquisition and integration, and have witnessed spectacular company implosion and failure first hand. I've built and co-founded a company from scratch, helped raise hundreds of millions of venture capital, worked inside a blue-chip VC firm as a partner and personally angel invested in 30+ companies.

investors.name: Nate Cooper
investors.bio: Nate started Barrel Ventures out of a passion to help others disrupt the status quo. Surrounded by entrepreneurs at a young age, Nate became an operator himself as a founder of L3 Hospitality Group and later Wise Apple, a company that set out to change kids' lunch.Nate is a graduate of the Goizueta School of Business at Emory University and received his MBA from the Kellogg School of Management where he was awarded a Kellogg Scholarship and named a Zell Fellow.In his free time, Nate is a passionate endurance athlete and movie quote savant. He lives in Chicago and serves on the associate boards of the US Holocaust Memorial Museum and Social Venture Partners.

investors.name: Neil Devani
investors.bio: Neil invests in companies that improve people's lives. He primarily focuses on companies using deep technologies and those in the healthcare, financial services, and education sectors. Neil is also an advisor to Upsolve, a bankruptcy nonprofit that has helped individuals clear hundreds of millions of dollars of primarily medical debt, and to Copia, a venture-backed technology company that has delivered over three million meals to people in need.

investors.name: Nick Pappageorge
investors.bio: Nick is on the research and ventures teams at Delphi Digital. Nick has a focus on DeFi, but invests across crypto sectors. Previously, Nick was a longtime analyst at CB Insights, where he covered crypto, fintech, and payments.

investors.name: Nicole Williams Ruiz
investors.bio: Nicole is an investor at an early stage, thesis driven, frontier tech fund called Compound. She invests in all areas of frontier tech but is focused on digital health and personalized medicine, machine learning & federated learning, lab automation, game engines, and near term hybrid quantum classical algorithms and quantum sensing. Previously she worked with a startup running experimental educational initiatives to create hands-on learning experiences for under-represented groups to cutting edge STEM domains with organizations like NASA, DARPA, and the NIH; studied data science and worked at Capterra, a Gartner company. Nicole is based in NYC, and invests globally.

investors.name: Nik  Sharma
investors.bio: Nik is the CEO of Sharma Brands, a strategic-initiatives firm working with a wide range of brands to help grow and scale revenue across digital platforms. Nik is one of AdWeek’s Young & Influential, Forbes 30 under 30, and an investor and advisor to some of the fastest-growing brands in commerce.His work with hyper-growth brands like Hint Water, Pill Club, and JUDY has resulted in new strategies, milestones, and millions of dollars in additional revenue for the companies. He has a keen eye for sociological advancements in culture and a data-driven mind for what works and what doesn’t in a rapidly changing environment.We live in a world where data is abundant but what to do with that data is where Nik thrives. The balance between research, content, distribution, and unknowns is his juggling act. Nik lives in New York where he spends much of his spare time solving the Rubik’s Cube of cost-effectively driving sales for his brand partners.

investors.name: Nikhil Basu Trivedi
investors.bio: Nikhil is the Co-Founder & General Partner at Footwork, an early-stage focused venture capital firm investing its first fund ($175M). He is the author of next big thing (nbt.substack.com).

investors.name: Niko Bonatsos
investors.bio: Niko Bonatsos is a Managing Director at the venture firm General Catalyst, partnering with founders from seed to growth stage and beyond to build companies that withstand the test of time. Niko focuses his investment strategy on finding first-time technology founders with strong product instincts, a robust appetite for learning, and a desire to create innovations with the potential to benefit millions. Niko is currently obsessed with partnering with technical Gen Z founders who are building products for themselves.Niko’s portfolio of investments includes: Audius, Bounce, Celo, ClassDojo, Collective, Cover, Discord, Dubsmash (acquired by Reddit), Ecologi, Jadu, Hive, Livongo [acquired by Teladoc (NYSE: TDOC)], Medely, Microverse, Numerade, Paribus (acquired by CapitalOne), Remote, Saturn, Seafair, Sleeper, Snap (NYSE: SNAP), Superplay, Tempus Ex, Wag!, and ZestWorld, among others.

investors.name: Nilesh Trivedi
investors.bio: Over two decades of Operational, Technology Management and creating new businesses experience at fortune corporations and early stage companies. I have helped create and guide more than a dozen new companies from ground up. Many of them venture capital backed, in sectors ranging from Enterprise Software, Security, Mobile Tech, B2B, Hardware and Frontier Technologies such as Aeriel Vehicles, 3D Printing, Connected Cars and Autonomous Vehicles.

investors.name: Nimi Katragadda
investors.bio: Nimi is a Partner at BoxGroup, an early stage venture firm, where she focuses on investments in financial tech, healthcare, marketplaces, and software. BoxGroup's portfolio includes companies such as PillPack, Plaid, Airtable, ClassPass, Warby Parker, Flatiron Health, and Ro, among many others. In her role, she sources and invests in entrepreneurs building disruptive technology companies that aim to create category defining businesses. Prior to BoxGroup, she worked in Investment Banking at J.P. Morgan and later as an Associate Product Marketing Manager at Google, focused on growing small business advertisers. She graduated with an Honors BA degree from Harvard, majoring in Economics and Government, and also received an MBA with Distinction from Harvard Business School. In 2017, Nimi was named to the Forbes 30 Under 30 list for Venture Capital.

investors.name: Nolan Church
investors.bio: Nolan is an angel investor and CEO of Continuum, a labor marketplace that connects executives to companies for fractional and full-time opportunities. Prior to Continuum, Nolan was the Chief People Officer at Carta and Head of Talent at DoorDash.

investors.name: Parasvil Patel
investors.bio: Parasvil Patel is a Partner with Radical Ventures where he works with visionary entrepreneurs using AI to transform traditional industries. Prior to joining Radical, Parasvil was with KKR where he supported diligence and portfolio value creation efforts across multiple asset classes and industries. During business school, he led go-to-market and fundraising activities for an early-stage cloud startup. He received a B.Tech. in Electrical Engineering from IIT Bombay and an MBA with High Distinction from Harvard Business School, where he graduated as a Baker Scholar.

investors.name: Parul Singh
investors.bio: Parul Singh is a product-driven founder and investor with a background in engineering, product strategy, and analytics. Parul spent the past five years on the investing team at Founder Collective, a tech-focused, early-stage seed fund where she covered Boston and NYC, evaluated over 3,000 companies, and spearheaded the firm’s investments in Embark Veterinary, Broadlume, Running Tide, HumanFirst, Flume Health, and HealthNote. Prior to investing, she spent close to a decade as an engineer and product manager at the NYTimes.com, Inc. and Fast Company, and she was the founder of a learning analytics company. At Initialized, Parul will focus her investing efforts on software companies, with a special interest in the areas of healthtech, SaaS, and analytics. Parul has an undergraduate degree from Harvard College and an MBA from MIT.

investors.name: Pasha Tinkov
investors.bio: Pasha Tinkov is a Co-Founder and Managing Partner at Audeo Ventures. Previously, he co-founded and served as Executive Director of LJTS Group, a global macro hedge fund headquartered in London. Before establishing LJTS Group, he held positions at several private equity firms and fintech startups in London, where he developed an extensive venture capital network. He holds a triple degree in Finance and Economics from the University of Southern California, the Hong Kong University of Science and Technology, and Bocconi University.

investors.name: Patrick Harmon
investors.bio: Investor at B Capital Group Ascent Fund in LA. Passionate about partnering with talented founders addressing disruptive macro trends. Focus on vertical SaaS and b2b marketplaces. Bias for vertical solutions in massive, fragmented, legacy industries with low NPS, or B2B/B2B2C solutions with B2C virality.\n\nPrevious investor at Morpheus Ventures, BMW i Ventures and Dalus Capital.

investors.name: Patrick Mathieson
investors.bio: I invest in startups as part of the early-stage venture team at Toba Capital. Some of my focus areas are B2B software, vertical SaaS, SMB platforms, and physical and digital retail. I’m privileged to serve on the boards of Toba companies FloQast, Skupos, Boulevard, Small Door Veterinary, and Brella. Some other private companies I’ve invested in are DataPlor, Anagram, FleetPanda, Luxury Presence, Samply, Hardfin, and Candid Wholesale. My prior investments include PatientPop (merged with Kareo to form Tebra), NurseGrid, Stella Connect, Reach150, and Transifex (all acquired).

investors.name: Patrick  Salyer
investors.bio: Patrick brings more than a decade of enterprise leadership experience to Mayfield. He is the former CEO of Mayfield portfolio company Gigya, customer identity and access management leader, which was acquired by SAP. As a first-time CEO who built Gigya into a successful enterprise company, he brings a company building playbook which can serve as a model for entrepreneurs. His operational expertise includes successfully navigating multiple product pivots, establishing a new market category, and scaling to more than $100M ARR and hundreds of employees. He has proven go-to-market expertise, having built global inside and field sales models, and achieved high growth rates.

investors.name: Paul Levine
investors.bio: Paul is a General Partner at Sapphire Ventures and leads investments in fintech, SMB/vertical SaaS, proptech, and marketplaces. He brings 20 years of experience as an operator and leader of high-growth organizations including Trulia, Zillow Group, Yahoo!, and E*TRADE. Paul is a board member at Restream and Side. He led Sapphire Ventures’ investments in AvidXchange, Mercury, and Tonal, and is active with investments in Current and Podium. Prior to joining Sapphire, Paul was president and COO of Trulia, where he helped lead Trulia’s transformation from a private 100-person company with $20 million in revenue, to a successful standalone public company and to its eventual merger with Zillow Group (NASDAQ: ZG) to create a company with more than 3,000 employees, $1 billion in revenue and $10 billion in market capitalization.

investors.name: Pejman Nozad
investors.bio: Pejman is the founding managing partner of Pear VC, which has assembled a nearly $50 billion portfolio. He is a seed investor in DoorDash, Guardant Health, AppLovin and Dropbox. A soccer fanatic and onetime professional player, Nozad was awarded the Ellis Island Medal of Honor in 2014, which celebrates American citizens who give back to their communities while maintaining connections with their ethnic heritages.

investors.name: Peter Livingston
investors.bio: Peter is the Founder/GP at Unpopular Ventures - a Rolling Fund and Syndicate that has invested >$30m across over 100 startups since 2019. We focus on "the best companies, off the beaten path." You can learn more about us at unpopular.vc

investors.name: Pierre  Giraud
investors.bio: Pierre is the founder and CEO of Indigo, a Venture Studio focussing on Mental Health and ConsciousTech.Prior to founding Indigo, Pierre had successes as a strategic consultant at Ernst & Young, Founding Partner at Greenflex (greentech startup in Europe, $100M+ revenue), and Founding Partner at Standard Dose (curated e-commerce for holistic wellness)Pierre has worked in NYC, London and Paris and has been practicing Capoeira for the last ten years, ranking as Graduado in 2019.

investors.name: Promise Phelon
investors.bio: Promise is the GP of Growth Warrior Capital. Promise has a mentor capital approach to investing and meets diverse and female founders where they are and provides capital, connections and conditioning specific to the needs of the founders. With her extensive CEO background and experience in raising from seed to exit, Promise provides the things necessary for growth! Growth Warrior Capital also provides a community network of founders, other investors and experts in their field to provide the necessary tools for founders to produce unparalleled returns.

investors.name: Qasar Younis
investors.bio: I am an engineer and product manager who has started 3 companies. My first company failed, my second company was acquired by Google and my third company is on a great trajectory. Previously I was a Partner and COO at Y Combinator. I've invested in over a hundred companies as an angel -- including being the largest pre-seed investor in Mercury :)

investors.name: Rachel Star
investors.bio: Rachel is Principal at Unusual helping to build and support the firm’s consumer investments. Rachel’s passion for business lies at the intersection of products and people. Rachel started her career as a consultant with McKinsey & Company with a focus on consumer brands, retailers, supply chain, and manufacturing. She then joined the Corporate Strategy team at Nordstrom Inc. Most recently, Rachel was an early-stage investor on the consumer team at Shasta Ventures. Rachel grew up in the San Francisco Bay Area, a place that has given her a deep appreciation for the entrepreneurial journey. She was a part of the team that launched SparkTruck, a non-profit organization that brought design-thinking curriculum to students across the country via a mobile classroom. She has been a speaker at TED events, for the Aspen Institute, and at Autodesk University. Rachel holds a BS from Northwestern University where she studied Manufacturing Engineering and Psychology.

investors.name: Rafeh Saleh
investors.bio: Rafeh launched Cubit Ventures and Founder Institute Egypt, sits on Falak Startups board, is an advisor to Egypt Ventures and Loyal VC, and led one of the largest consulting firms in Egypt. He is an experienced triple-digit track record executive, entrepreneur, and management consultant where he advised numerous companies of all sizes on growth, turnaround, and business restructuring strategies.

investors.name: Rahul Prakash
investors.bio: Rahul is a successful 3x technology entrepreneur turned venture capitalist. The last company he co-founded, MyEnergy, sold to Nest prior to Google's $3.2B acquisition. His previous company sold to NRG Energy (NYSE:NRG) for $120MM. His first venture backed company, Spock, sold to Intelius in 2009.  In 2013, he founded NOMO Ventures, a venture capital fund with $115 million in assets under management. In a previous life, he served as a Press Secretary to a number of city & statewide elected officials and also had a stint in the music industry with Columbia/RuffHouse Records. He also loves hip hop, hoops, and single malt.

investors.name: Ravi Grover
investors.bio: 8-year career at FB as a data scientist / engineer followed by successful angel investing. Now running a fund with 3 amazing partners to support great data tech founders - core or applied. Love advances in data tech, but also applied to underserved industries. Helpful first, investment second.

investors.name: Raymond Tonsing
investors.bio: Raymond Tonsing is a San Francisco based technology investor and entrepreneur. He is the founder and managing partner of Caffeinated Capital, a technology investment firm with a portfolio that includes Affirm, Airtable, Brex, Color, dYdX, Opendoor, Virta, and Wish. Previously, Mr. Tonsing was a partner at Akkadian Ventures, a secondary fund focused on providing liquidity to founders, early employees, and angel investors of private, high-growth technology companies. Before that, Mr. Tonsing helped develop and manage Energy Central and Rigzone, two market-leading technology platforms that provide information on the energy industry. Mr. Tonsing received his B.A. from the University of Colorado, Boulder.

investors.name: Rich Maloy
investors.bio: Rich’s mission is to rebuild the American dream through entrepreneurship. He spent seven years in finance, including managing reporting and analysis for a $1 billion division of News Corp. His natural rapport-building led to a second career in business development, where he was a multiple-time global top 10 salesman. From there, Rich moved coasts and turned his attention towards entrepreneurship in Boulder, Colorado, culminating in three years as the N. America Manager for IBM’s Global Entrepreneur Program. Rich's experience leading a team that onboarded over 3,000 startups per year revealed Rich’s keenest talent: incubating startups so they can meet the needs of the enterprise, win contracts, and raise capital. Rich engages with thousands of startups from all over the world through his Daily Dealflow newsletter, VC Minute mini-podcast, mentoring and investing activities. He is a founding partner at SpringTime Ventures where he's made over 30 investments.

investors.name: Richard Dulude
investors.bio: Co-Founder & Partner at Underscore VC, a US-based venture firm focused on enterprise software from the earliest stages (pre-seed, seed, series A).With $250M AUM to date, across three funds, we have built only 22 world class LP relationships with institutions, endowments, family offices, and strategic individuals.I am also personally an LP into many early stage managers in Europe with intent to increase that portfolio.

investors.name: Richard Jhang
investors.bio: Richard is the CEO of StratMinds, a San Francisco-based venture capital investment and advisory firm. The firm supports exceptional entrepreneurs with an ambition to generate an outsized impact with early-stage investment and strategic advice. StratMinds is a thesis-driven firm, focusing on key areas of development that are disrupting the world for the better. Richard has managed significant growth and scales of businesses globally in tech, financial services and professional services (startups to Fortune 500). Throughout his career, he has also advised C-level executives and boards on various strategic matters including corporate development and transformation. He is seen as a well-rounded entrepreneur, operator, and investor.

investors.name: Rico Mallozzi
investors.bio: Rico is a Vice President at Sapphire Sport where he leads and sources investment opportunities across the media, crypto, entertainment, and consumer software landscape. Rico is particularly passionate about virtual worlds and decentralized technology. He oversees Sapphire Sport’s unique platform of investors, networks, and communities to help drive tangible results to Sport’s portfolio. Rico has actively worked on investments in FalconX, Tonal, Flowhaven, Manticore, and Buzzer. Rico is a board observer at Flowhaven.Rico’s experience in the technology industry spans across multiple functional areas. He began his career working at start-ups in the renewable energy industry and more recently held positions at Cisco and SAP. Rico has also supported entrepreneurs in Indonesia and Sri Lanka in developing business models for social venture funds.Rico has lived and worked in Italy, Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Singapore, and Thailand.

investors.name: Robert Wesley
investors.bio: Robert is an Associate at Cameron Ventures, an early-stage fund primarily focused on FinTech / InsurTech opportunities most often at the Seed and Series A stages. Prior to joining Cameron, he spent time at Financial Technology Partners in both their research and banking groups covering multiple sectors within FinTech.

investors.name: Roberto Sanabria
investors.bio: Currently Managing Partner of Expa, Roberto originally joining as a founding member in 2013. He’s served as a board member or board advisor to six Expa companies, and has worked closely with many more, partnering with the founding teams of several Expa companies including Metabase, Aero, Kit, and Input. Roberto has over 15 years of experience working in tech in Silicon Valley, with particular expertise in FP&A, product and growth analysis, business operations, revenue forecasting, and managing financials for the fund. Before joining Expa, Roberto worked on business analytics at LinkedIn and Stumbleupon, and has held various finance and business operations positions at Google, including launching Google’s Australia and South East Asia operations. He started his career as a business analyst at Capital One. Roberto earned his B.A. in Finance and a B.S. in Economics from the University of Pennsylvania and the Wharton School of Business.

investors.name: Roger Dickey
investors.bio: Roger Dickey is the founder & CEO of Made Renovation, a home renovation company backed by Founders Fund. Made is based in San Francisco and has remodeled hundreds of bathrooms using our renovation technology platform.Prior to Made, Roger founded Gigster, a managed software development marketplace which serves 10% of the Fortune 500 and thousands of small & medium sized companies. Gigster has raised $32M in financing from investors including Andreessen-Horowitz, Redpoint Ventures, and NBA legend Michael Jordan.Roger's first business was Curiosoft, an Austin-based gaming studio founded in 2007. After an acquisition by Zynga, Roger went on to found Mafia Wars (100M users) and FishVille (35M users).Roger is an investor or advisor in 70+ startups including 11 unicorns and 10 companies worth over $100M. He holds mentorship roles with the Disney Accelerator and Thiel Fellowship.

investors.name: Saar Gur
investors.bio: Saar is a General Partner at CRV and was recently highlighted as #34 in the Forbes Midas List of the World’s Best Venture Capital Investors In 2021.Saar loves products that consumers and customers LOVE (over the moon LOVE), and is passionate about helping his companies succeed.He has been involved at the seed/Series A in companies like Doordash, Patreon, Ring, Classpass, Mercury and others.Saar has also been involved in over 20 acquisitions in the past few years by firms such as Google, Facebook, Apple, Disney, Rakuten and Intuit.Prior to CRV, Saar was a co-founder of BrightRoll, a leading video ad platform acquired by Yahoo for $640m in cash. He has a Stanford MBA, a biochem degree from University of Wisconsin and loves to kitesurf.

investors.name: Sahil Lavingia
investors.bio: I am the founder and CEO of Gumroad, a service that helps creators get paid for their work—over $350 million to date. We raised money in 2011 and 2012 from Kleiner Perkins, First Round, Naval Ravikant, Chris Sacca, among others.I am also active on Twitter (160K followers) and write irregular essays. I got my start in Silicon Valley as employee #2 at Pinterest.Though I took a break from 2012–2016 to focus on Gumroad, I have angel invested in about 30 startups including Clubhouse, Lambda School, Figma, Notion, Vercel, HelloSign, and Movable Ink.

investors.name: Sam Campbell
investors.bio: Sam is an investor at Samsung Next, an early-stage corporate venture arm of Samsung Electronics, where he focuses on crypto & fintech companies. Prior to joining Next, Sam was  managing direct venture investments for Stanford University. Sam has actively partnered with companies at the earliest stages, including jumping in part-time to build in the trenches with founders. Sam resides in the SF Bay Area with his growing family.

investors.name: Samit Kalra
investors.bio: Samit is a partner at 1984 Ventures, a seed fund focused on software upending antiquated industries. Prior to joining 1984, Samit was a VC at Bain Capital Ventures, focusing on B2B companies at seed and Series A. Before joining Bain, Samit spent time as an operator at AngelList, helping them grow their fundraising business (syndicates and funds).

investors.name: Sandeep Bhadra
investors.bio: Sandeep is a partner at Vertex Ventures US, a seed/Series A fund based in San Francisco and Palo Alto, investing in B2B software and services. Vertex US is part of a network of funds in Israel, SE Asia, India, and China. Vertex US focuses on cloud infrastructure software (open source, dev tools, cyber security), application software powered by data warehouses and machine learning, and vertical software in large undigitized markets like finance, insurance, manufacturing and construction. Prior to Vertex, Sandeep was a principal at Menlo Ventures where he led investments in Platform9, Signifyd, Clarifai, Okera, Unravel Data. At Vertex, he works with the founders at Tulip, Hasura, LeaseLock, BrokerBuddha, Gitpod and others.

investors.name: Sara Choi
investors.bio: Investor/Partner at Wing VC, formerly an enterprise entrepreneur before selling my last data/b2b co. Now I'm a Partner at Wing VC where I lead our investments at the intersection of data x bio/health.

investors.name: Sarah Fu
investors.bio: Sarah Fu is the Founder and Managing Partner at Elsa Capital, a seed-stage fund focused on the intersection of fintech and AI. Prior to founding Elsa Capital, Sarah was the CEO and co-founder of a fintech startup that was accepted into YC. Sarah brings deep operational expertise from Stripe as a product, strategy and finance leader and helped grow the company 10x. Before Stripe, Sarah was a public market investor at Fidelity and started her career in investment banking at Morgan Stanley.

investors.name: Satya Patel
investors.bio: Partner @ Homebrew, Formerly VP Product @ Twitter and Product leader @ Google. Investor in awesome companies including Bowery Farming, Chime, Gusto, Honor, Plaid, Shield AI, and Weave

investors.name: Scott Belsky
investors.bio: Scott Belsky is an executive, entrepreneur, author, and investor (and all-around product obsessive). He currently serves as Adobe's Chief Product Officer and Executive Vice President, Creative Cloud. Scott's passion is to make the creative world more productive, connected, and adaptive to new technologies. Scott co-founded Behance in 2006, and served as CEO until Adobe acquired Behance in 2012. Millions of people use Behance to display their portfolios, as well as track and find top talent across the creative industries. After Behance's acquisition, Scott helped kick off Creative Cloud’s services and reboot Adobe's mobile product strategy and led Behance until 2016, when he spent a few years as an investor and advisor to multiple businesses.Alongside his role at Adobe, Scott actively advises and invests in businesses that cross the intersection of technology and design - and help empower people.

investors.name: Seema Amble
investors.bio: Seema Amble is a partner focused on early stage SaaS and B2B fintech investments globally. She joined the firm in 2019. Prior to joining Andreessen Horowitz, Seema had been investing in software for over a decade. She was a vice president at Goldman Sachs Investment Partners, a venture growth fund, and before that LeapFrog Investments and Altamont Capital Partners. She began her career at Blackstone.

investors.name: Sergio Romo
investors.bio: As CEO of Grin, I helped to grow the company from $0 to over $40M USD in annual revenue and the team from 4 to 2000 people with operations in 7 countries (Brazil, Mexico, Colombia, Chile, Argentina, Peru and Uruguay) and 22 cities (Sao Paulo, Rio de Janeiro, Mexico City, Lima, Bogota, Buenos Aires, Santiago et al) in less than two years. Sergio also co-founded Investo, an investment firm to invest in companies in early stage startups, leading seed investments in Rappi, Solugen, Mercury, Justo, Ripio, Cambly, Unbabel and 70+ more startups like Nowports, Beek, Casai, BillPocket, YoTePresto, 100 Ladrillos, Eva and Runa. Sergio Romo co-founded Miorden.com in 2010. In 2012 SinDelantal.com bought MiOrden.com who later sold to JustEat to become the leader in Mexico in food delivery from 2013-2016. Sergio has been a mentor to over a 100 technology startups and writes essays about entrepreneurship atwww.medium.com/@romo

investors.name: Seth Bannon
investors.bio: Seth Bannon is a Founding Partner at Fifty Years. Seth has seeded a range of startups shaping the world for the better — companies like Upside Foods (culturing meat to eat), Solugen (engineering enzymes to produce industrial chemicals sustainably), and Astranis (small satellites to cover the Earth in Internet). Seth is also the co-founder of Impact.Tech, a community of entrepreneurs combining purpose with profit, and was previously the founder & CEO of startup Amicus. A graduate of Y Combinator, Seth was named twice to the Forbes 30 Under 30 list for Social Entrepreneurship. An avid chess player, Seth can occasionally be found in parks around the world attempting to hustle chess hustlers.

investors.name: Severin Hacker
investors.bio: Severin co-founded Duolingo (NASDAQ: DUOL) in 2011, to help people learn languages. Severin is the CTO of Duolingo. Severin completed his Ph.D. in Computer Science at Carnegie Mellon University, where he researched large scale human computation. He is also a recipient of the 2014 MIT Technology Review TR35 award. Severin completed his BS in Computer Science at ETH Zurich in 2006.

investors.name: Shane Mac
investors.bio: I'm the Co-founder & President of XMTP.com. We are building a new communication protocol for crypto. It's basically just a new way to email using wallets. We just raised $25m led by a16z.\n\nI'm the Founder & General Partner of Logos Labs. We invest in the future of remote work & crypto. Our companies have a combined valuation of $1.5+ billion. Founders & LPs, please reach out and say hello.

investors.name: Sheel Mohnot
investors.bio: Co-founder of Better Tomorrow Ventures - a seed-focused venture capital firm investing in exceptional founders building transformative fintech companies around the world.I've been exclusively investing in fintech companies for the past 6 years. Prior to that I had a couple of successful FinTech exits of my own.Aside from fintech, I co-founded the podcast "The Pitch" which was acquired by Gimlet Media (reaches ~100k weekly listeners), and a food company called Thistle that serves 10's of thousands of customers every week.

investors.name: Shruti Gandhi
investors.bio: Shruti is a professor in the CS department at Columbia University, a founder and managing partner at Array Ventures — a deeptech, enterprise, early stage fund—and an Engineer and Operator with 6+ exits to Apple, Paypal, ServiceNow, Samsung, and We Company.Array invests in enterprise deep tech early stage companies. Shruti spent her early career as a developer on mainframe security, collaboration tools, and data analytics. Post engineering, she was investing in early stage companies at True Ventures and Samsung's venture fund. She has an MBA from University of Chicago and MS from Columbia University.

investors.name: Siqi Chen
investors.bio: Siqi is the founder and CEO of Runway, an a16z funded startup enabling operators to understand their business without needing a degree in finance.As an operator and founder: Siqi was CEO of Sandbox VR (a16z), VP of Product and Growth at Postmates (acquired by Uber), CEO of Hey, Inc (Google-funded, acquired by Postmates), Head of Product at Zynga (IPO 2011), CEO of Serious Business (funded by Lightspeed, acquired by Zynga)Siqi is an investor in nearly a hundred companies like Clubhouse, Amplitude, Pipe, and Italic.Previously, Siqi worked at NASA JPL, where he was the only person to ever receive a Congressional Space Act award while in school, for his contributions to machine vision technology on the Mars Exploration Rovers.

investors.name: Sohail Prasad
investors.bio: Sohail is the Founder & CEO of Destiny (D/XYZ), an investment management company that provides public access to the private tech markets. Prior to founding Destiny, Sohail was the Founder and CEO of Forge, a global private securities marketplace building trading, custody, and data infrastructure to meet the needs of high-growth unicorn companies, employees, and investors. Today, Forge transacts billions in pre-IPO stock annually, has over $14B in assets under custody, and recently announced that it will be going public in a $2B merger with SPAC Motive Capital Corp (NYSE:MOTV), becoming the first dedicated trading platform for private shares to become a public company. Prior to founding Forge in 2014, Sohail was among the youngest founders to go through Y Combinator as an eighteen-year-old.
