Over the years, Sohail has advised and invested in over 150 startups, including notable startups such as Rappi, Rippling, Notion, Retool, Astranis, Superhuman, Mercury, and Zenefits.

investors.name: Soraya  Darabi
investors.bio: Soraya is a founder of TMV, a venture firm investing in startups reimagining the future. TMV backs companies focused on ideas that will reshape industries or inspire new ones. Her investments include: Figs, Casper, Cityblock, Hungryroot, Kindbody, Parsley Health, Ridwell, Gimlet, Clockwise, Running Tide,  Bulletin.Soraya began her career as Manager of Social Media at The New York Times. She went on to co-found the application Foodspotting, named by Apple as an “App of the Year" (acquired by OpenTable). Soraya has been featured on the cover of Fast Company magazine's “100 Most Creative People in Business” issue and on the cover of Brand Week. She was named a Fortune Magazine "40 Under 40" (2015). She sat on the digital advisory board of GE, is a WEF "Young Global Leader," a 6-time mentor to TechStars New York - 3-times "Mentor of the Year." Soraya graduated magna cum lade from Georgetown University, completed the Global Leadership and Public Policy module at Harvard Kennedy School.

investors.name: Stephanie Zhan
investors.bio: Stephanie Zhan is a partner on the early-stage investing team at Sequoia Capital. She loves partnering with companies across consumer and enterprise, starting at the earliest of stages at the Seed and Series A and helping them scale over time. She is on the board of companies including Rec Room, Linear, Middesk, Sunday, and Brud.

investors.name: Stephen Schmalhofer
investors.bio: Stephen is a partner at Teamworthy Ventures. He focuses on fintech & insurtech, sales & marketing SaaS, sports tech, and marketplaces/networks. He also leads Teamworthy’s Summer Associate program. Prior to Teamworthy Ventures, Stephen led business development as a member of the founding team of a New York edtech startup. He began his career at Swiss Re Capital Markets and Odyssey Re (a subsidiary of Fairfax Financial). Stephen graduated from Yale College with a B.A. in History and an Ivy League football championship. He lives in Connecticut with his wife and their four daughters.

investors.name: Steven Lee
investors.bio: Steven Lee is a Partner at SV Angel. As a member of Twitter’s Global Market Insight & Analytics team, Steven was one of the first employees focused on monetization analytics. He partnered with Fortune 500 companies to analyze and optimize return on investment, and worked on measuring Twitter’s platform usage for key real‐time events. During his 4 years with the team, Steven helped to grow the group to 50+ people, in 11 country offices. Following his time at Twitter, Steven was an investor at Bain Capital Ventures and Correlation. Over the course of his tenure he was responsible for sourcing and diligencing 25+ companies that led to early-stage investments for the firms, including Clockwise and Manticore, alongside SV Angel. He is the proud son of two immigrants from South Korea and grew up in Los Angeles’ Koreatown district.

investors.name: Stu Smith
investors.bio: Stu is General Partner at Coughdrop Capital and COO/Co-Founder at Racket. He was most recently Senior Vice President, Creator at WarnerMedia running their creator business Fullscreen. Stu has spent the majority of his career driving innovation in the entertainment and media space. With nearly 20 years of experience, Stu led the North American launch of CrowdSurge (later merged with Songkick) and helped scale Red Light Management, the largest music management company in the world. Since then, he has held executive positions leading the revenue organizations at Teespring and Omaze.

investors.name: Susan Liu
investors.bio: Susan invests in software for enterprises, small-to-medium businesses and employees, no matter where they work: at home or in an office. She has spent a decade analyzing SaaS businesses across multiple dimensions and is constantly on the hunt for net-new ideas — products and markets that don’t yet exist, but which solve legitimate, provable problems.Prior to joining Uncork Capital in 2021, Susan spent nine years as a software investor at Scale Venture Partners, where she studied workplace trends and b2b software. Her experience in working with Series A and Series B companies means she knows what it takes for seed startups to reach the next milestone.

investors.name: Teddy Blank
investors.bio: Teddy Blank has spent his career working to grow companies from their earliest days and answering the question of, "how do we get our first ten customers?".He was previously co-founder of Tempo, a secure, differential privacy-enabled marketplace for biometric data from top athletes.Prior to starting Tempo, Teddy led Sales and BD for Symphony Commerce, an ecommerce service as a platform startup backed by $52m from CRV, Bain, and FirstMark which grew revenues to $10M+ ARR in less than three years.Teddy began his career as an analyst at Accenture, working across industries from telecom to banking to public transit. He is an advisor to early-stage deep tech startups and loves the challenge of taking a business from zero to the moon. Teddy holds an MBA from Harvard University and a BA from Amherst College.

investors.name: Terrence Rohan
investors.bio: Based in San Francisco, I’m a startup investor. I’ve been a board member, advisor, investor to 75+ companies over the past 10+ years. I am a seed investor in companies like Figma, Front, Granola, Hugging Face, Notion, Robinhood, Vanta, etc. I love what I do.In addition to supporting founders, I am building Otherwise. If you’ve ever thought founders should be able invest millions into their peers (i.e. other founders), just like a venture capitalist, well, that’s Otherwise. You won’t find much on the Internet about Otherwise, and that’s on purpose.

investors.name: Thomas Chen
investors.bio: Tom is a partner at MAGIC Fund, a global pre-seed and seed stage venture fund led by founders who have collectively raised over $1B in venture capital throughout our careers. Tom is a multi-time startup founder with his first exit to a publicly traded company at the age of 17. He studied CS at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign and worked as  Software Engineer for fast growing startups like Albert and Atomic Labs (Hims, Zenreach, etc).

investors.name: Thomson Nguyen
investors.bio: Thomson is the CEO and Co-founder of Hatch. Previously, he was an Entrepreneur in Residence at KPCB. Before that, he was the Founder/CEO of Framed Data (acquired by Square.) He is also a visiting scholar at New York University's Courant Institute for Mathematical Sciences.

investors.name: Tiffany Luck
investors.bio: Tiffany Luck is a Partner at GGV Capital and is focused on enterprise SaaS, the API economy, and SMBTech. She led GGV’s investments in Mindee, Pinwheel, Stream, and Yac and serves on the board of directors or as a board observer. She is also a board observer for or actively involved with GGV’s investments in Belong, Electric, Fairmarkit, Handshake, Vic.ai, and WorkBoard.

investors.name: Tim  Griffin
investors.bio: I founded Cloosiv (YC S19), where I led our growth from initial prototype, to the highest-rated mobile ordering app for coffee shops in the Apple App Store and Google Play Store. Collectively, the Cloosiv app was downloaded by 125,000 users, who spent over $10 million dollars across 500+ cafés using our product. I've raised millions in venture capital to support the small business economy and orchestrated Cloosiv's merger with Odeko, where I continue to focus on democratizing access to innovative technology for small businesses.

investors.name: Tina Bou-Saba
investors.bio: Tina Bou-Saba is Co-Founder and Co-Managing Partner at Verity Venture Partners, an early-stage consumer-focused investment firm. VVP invests in purpose-driven entrepreneurs building the next generation of great consumer companies, including emerging brands and enabling technologies. Tina has been actively investing since 2016 through CXT Investments, her personal vehicle, focused on beauty, personal care, health/wellness, e-commerce, and enabling technology. Tina is a problem solver, creative and independent thinker, and trusted partner to entrepreneurs. She is passionate about supporting female and diverse founders. After starting her career in investment banking at Morgan Stanley, she covered retail as an equity analyst at Sanford Bernstein and Berman Capital. As a member of the strategy team at Victoria’s Secret, Tina worked closely with VS leadership to commercialize new business opportunities. She attended Phillips Exeter Academy, Harvard College, and Harvard Business School.

investors.name: Tod Sacerdoti
investors.bio: CEO/Founder at Pipedream. Former CEO/Founder at BrightRoll (sold to Yahoo!). Investor in 100+ companies (AppLovin, Chime, Datavant, Gorgias, Iterable, Juniper Square, LiveRamp, Marqeta, Mercury, OneSignal, Retool, SafeGraph & Truework).

investors.name: Todd Goldberg
investors.bio: I’m an entrepreneur and early-stage investor with a passion for creating delightful products and experiences. I love creating something from nothing.I previously founded Eventjoy (YC W14), a ticketing company that was acquired by Ticketmaster. I’ve also designed, launched, and grown a dozen other products like Mailjoy, a DIY tool for direct mail.I’m an active angel investor. I’ve backed over 70 startups including Clearbit, Tandem, Mercury, Superhuman, Clubhouse, Future Fit, Pitch, ClassDojo, Daily, Coda, WorkOS, and Charthop.

investors.name: Tomer London
investors.bio: Tomer is the co-founder and Chief Product Officer of Gusto which helps over 200,000 businesses build their teams and is valued over$9.4B

investors.name: Triet Nguyen
investors.bio: Triet currently serves as Principal at Render Capital, where he focuses on investing in early-stage companies located outside the three major tech hubs. He brings extensive industry expertise in consumer markets and technology solutions targeting traditional legacy industries. In addition to his role at Render Capital, Triet has experience as an angel investor, supporting innovative startups with capital and strategic guidance. He also has board experience, where he provides valuable insights on fundraising, board dynamics, and go-to-market strategies, helping companies scale effectively and achieve their growth objectives.

investors.name: Tripp Jones
investors.bio: I am a Partner at Uncork Capital and invest broadly in information technology companies, with a particular focus on consumer, marketplace, and fintech companies. I also lead Uncork's later stage efforts.Previously, I was a General Partner at August Capital, a Senior Associate at Spectrum Equity, and started my career in the meat grinder as a fintech Analyst in investment banking.I led investments in ADARA, BARK, CommonBond, Compology, Hipcamp, Paperless Post, Quandl, Revel, Rocketmiles, SendBird, Spacious, Sun Basket, Wattpad, and Yumi, and was involved in investments in Amount, Avant, Ebates, Fastly , GitLab, Integral Ad Science , PubMatic, RJMetrics, Rockets of Awesome, Stitch Data, ThreatMetrix, and Zulily.My angel portfolio includes 100 Thieves, ALPEN, Alto IRA, Daring Foods, Fursure, neo.tax, and Saga.I went to Princeton University and I'm originally from the San Francisco Bay Area.

investors.name: Turner  Novak
investors.bio: Turner's the co-founder of Banana Capital. He was previously the Chief Meme Officer at Gelt VC and an intern at Afore Capital. He's based in Ann Arbor, MI and has not won any awards.

investors.name: Venky Karnam
investors.bio: Venky is a venture partner at Afore Capital. He is also an active investor in India based startups. Investments include Meesho, Groww, FamPay, Bueno Finance, Method Finance, FrontPage, Basis.

investors.name: Vibhor Chhabra
investors.bio: Vibhor is currently at Shopify where he is leading teams building FinTech products at the intersection of payments, taxes, and commerce. Previously, Vibhor was the Chief Product Officer at TaxJar which built the first product-led sales tax compliance product, and was recently acquired by Stripe. Before TaxJar, Vibhor was the head of product for the $800M payments business at Square. Before that Vibhor had various leadership roles at Campaign Monitor, Evernote, and SugarSync.

investors.name: Vyshakh Kodoth
investors.bio: Vyshakh Kodoth is an Investment Associate on the Venture Capital team where he focuses on sourcing, evaluating, and investing in the next generation of high-growth technology companies transforming the real estate technology sector. Prior to MetaProp, Vyshakh was at J.P. Morgan, where he worked on developing the firm's FinTech strategy through partnerships and investments. His areas of focus included mortgage product structuring, AI-based underwriting, origination software, and capital markets pricing. Vyshakh's experience also includes a stint in Fintech Investment Banking at Evolve Capital Partners, where he focused on M&A and growth equity transactions for emerging-stage companies in the financial technology sector.

investors.name: Wayne Chang
investors.bio: Wayne Chang is a serial entrepreneur and angel investor. His latest company, Crashlytics, was acquired by Twitter in its largest acquisition at the time. He has been involved in other notable startups such as Dropbox, Napster, and others, now valued at over $10 billion.He is also a limited partner in several prominent funds. As part of his passion for helping the next generation of entrepreneurs, he regularly speaks and lectures at universities such as Harvard, MIT, and Cornell, and also serves as a mentor for TechStars, Extreme Startups and MassChallenge.He was named 40 under 40 by Boston Business Journal and also awarded an honorary PhD by his alma mater, University of Massachusetts Amherst.

investors.name: Wen-Wen Lam
investors.bio: Wen-Wen is a partner at Gradient Ventures. Previously, Wen-Wen was the CEO & Co-founder of NexTravel (YCW15), a leading corporate travel solution that serviced thousands of customers like Lyft, Twilio, and Stripe. She grew the business to over $100M in annual sales before exiting to Travelperk in 2020. Prior to this, Wen-Wen worked with a number of startups in leadership roles. She started her career in tech at LinkedIn. She received her BA from UC Berkeley in Economics and her MBA from USC Marshall School of Business.

investors.name: Wes Tang-Wymer
investors.bio: Wes is co-founder and general partner at Rucker Park Capital, an early stage venture firm. Prior to Rucker Park, Wes focused on growth and late-stage investments at SoftBank, investing in startups such as Uber, Grab, SoFi, and Lemonade. He previously worked at a long/short equities hedge fund focused on technology and media companies. Wes is an Ohio native and graduated from Miami University.

investors.name: Will McClelland
investors.bio: Will is the Co-founder & General Partner at Elizabeth Street Ventures, an early stage investment firm focused on digital consumer & consumer fintech businesses transforming industry verticals and improving daily life. Part cultural anthropologist, part digital consumer investor, he brings 16+ years of experience investing, sourcing and portfolio construction across the venture capital and hedge fund industries. Elizabeth Street is the third investment fund where he is a partner and the first firm he has founded. Previously he was Partner at Grace Beauty Capital, a New York-based family office focused on early stage consumer businesses. Will was previously a Managing Director, Head of Research and the youngest Investment & Risk Committee member at Ironwood Capital Management. He graduated from Yale University with a B.A. double major in Anthropology and Economics.

investors.name: William Leonard
investors.bio: William is an investor at Valor Ventures, a seed lead fund based in Atlanta where he focuses on next generation B2B fintech, Web3 infrastructure, digital health, and creator economy platforms in the Southeast US. Prior to joining Valor Ventures, William worked at VU Venture Partners and Dynamo Ventures as an investor focusing on early stage software across the globe.

investors.name: Yehong Zhu
investors.bio: Yehong Zhu is the founder & CEO of Zette (zette.com), which unlocks access to paywalled articles. She is an angel investor in early stage companies, where her portfolio spans over 10 startups.Previously she worked a journalist at Forbes Magazine and a consumer PM at Twitter on the Tweets team in San Francisco and the Events team in London. She graduated from Harvard with a joint B.A. in philosophy and government and splits time between California and New York.

investors.name: Yigit Ihlamur
investors.bio: Prior to Vela, Yigit Ihlamur worked in Google’s Cloud division, at the company’s headquarters in Mountain View, on product management, strategy, operations, growth, startup and reseller partnerships. Yigit’s tenure at Google also included several years spent in the company’s European headquarters in Dublin, working on technical operations for G Suite. Yigit received his master’s degree in computer science with a focus on artificial intelligence and machine learning from the University of Oxford, and his industrial engineering degree from Koç University. As one of the founders of Vela Partners, he leads Ventech engineering efforts and works as a general partner.

investors.name: Yotis Tonnelier
investors.bio: What I've done so far: I've raised with my YOBE team more than $64M internationally over the past 3 years. I’ve advised and worked for the private office of HRH Prince Al Saud of Saudi Arabia to invest a total of $36M in different European startups. The investment portfolio has a ROI of 1050% since 2015. I’ve participated in multiple M&As and IPOs. I’ve been a consultant for many startups in Europe and the US. I've raised $1M on the Crowdfunding platform Kickstarter with one single project. I built 2 companies from A to Z (from $0 to $2M in sales) and sold one of them. Successfully participated in positive exits.

investors.name: Youcef Oudjidane
investors.bio: Youcef Oudjidane joined Class 5 from the Dubai Future Foundation (DFF) where he helped establish the Dubai Future Fund, a 1bn AED Venture Capital fund, and played a prominent role in several other initiatives contributing to the development of the tech ecosystem in the UAE. Prior to joining DFF, Youcef was a Senior Associate at Solebury Capital, a boutique Investment Bank in New York. Notable mandates include Snap Inc’s (Snapchat) $3.9bn IPO and King Digital Entertainment’s (Candy Crush) $500mm IPO. While at Solebury, Youcef also managed a $100mm co-investment fund.

investors.name: Yuri Sagalov
investors.bio: Yuri is the founder and General Partner of Wayfinder Ventures, a pre-seed/seed fund based in the Bay Area. Prior to Wayfinder Yuri worked at Y Combinator for 5 years as a Partner, and has also personally seed invested in over 50 companies (including Flexport, Solugen, Boom Supersonic, Ajaib, Observe AI, Lively, NURX, and many more). Yuri was previously a founder and a software engineer.

investors.name: Zach Coelius
investors.bio: Four-time entrepreneur and now investor in early stage technology companies.First $1B exit with an AngelList Syndicate when GM bought Cruise Automation. Former founder and CEO of Triggit.

investors.name: Zach DeWitt
investors.bio: Zach DeWitt is a Partner at Wing. Prior to Wing, Zach was CEO and co-founder of Drop, Inc., which built two award-winning iPhone apps (Drop Messages and Firefly) before selling its technology and intellectual property to Snapchat in 2016. Before founding Drop, Zach worked in the technology, media and telecommunications groups at both TPG Capital and Goldman Sachs, where he was involved with various technology deals, including TPG's investment in Uber.Zach holds a BA in Economics from Yale University, cum laude, and an MBA from the Harvard Business School, where he graduated as a Baker Scholar.Zach writes about the proliferation of product-led growth (PLG), highlighting the best (public + private) PLG companies in his weekly newsletter, Notorious PLG.
